loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is 52 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ezra is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ezra has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chamunda Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Paluben (first from left) is a hard-working woman from Bhachau, a small city in Kutch district in the state of Gujarat, in western India. She has been running her business of agriculture for years now. She grows and sells produce like grains and vegetables at the local market. Her efforts bring in Rs. 3,500 a month, contributing to almost 30 percent of her family’s monthly income. She sets aside this entire amount to put toward the education and future of her three children: two teenagers and a preschooler. She wants to save more, because this amount cannot guarantee that her three children will be able to access a complete education. 

She plans to increase her agricultural yield by investing in better fertilizers and quality seeds. She will grow wheat, millet, vegetables, and lemons. The returns would be huge, almost tripling her monthly income, leaving enough for her to fund her small-scale business. But a lack of access to funds stands in the way of her implementing these plans. 

Unwilling to let this dampen her spirits, she formed the Chamunda Mahila Mandal, a joint liability group, with three other fiercely independent women who, like many other local mothers, sustain their families by running their own successful microenterprises. Nishaben seeks to grow her animal husbandry microenterprise, and Champaben and Keshareben want to expand their vegetable selling businesses. Forming a group gives these women a chance to crowdfund the microfinance they need to grow the earning potential of their small-scale businesses. They collectively are seeking a microfinance loan of Rs. 50,000.

Paluben could not go to school. But she understands the importance of education and the role it plays in empowering people to uplift themselves out of poverty. So she is ready to work hard and provide the best of education to her children. Your loan will contribute toward her achieving this goal.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow her agricultural business

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 49 años de edad, muy humilde, luchadora, dinámica la cual a pesar de su edad ella piensa siempre en el presente para superarse no dejando las cosas para el mañana. Ella es casada y de su matrimonio tiene 5 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela de la comunidad y otros en el colegio mientras ella y su pareja asisten la planta de frijol. Doña Maria tiene su propia parcela en donde cultiva frijol y maíz ya desde hace varios años lo cual es y ha sido fuente de ingresos económicos en su familia ubicada a pocos metros de su casa de habitacion siendo sus clientes los diferentes dueños de bodegas, pulperías e intermediarios de los alrededores y locales. Como desafío encontrado en este negocio es la baja de los precios en el mercado pues espera en los próximos días o meses este mejore para poder percibir mejores ingresos y mejorar la situación económica en su familia. Por lo cual en esta ocasión ella solicita apoyo económico por parte de los diferentes inversionistas para la compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de granos básicos y la compra de semilla de maíz certificada para poder sembrar. Una de sus metas es terminar su casa de habitacion la cual está a medias y necesita muchas cosas para hacer de esta segura, también apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y que puedan graduarse de la secundaria y si Dios lo permite seguir apoyándoles en la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and is a modest, active and hard-working woman. Despite her age, she is always thinking about what she can do right now to make her life better, and she doesn't put things off for later.

Maria is married and she has 5 children who study in elementary and high school in her community, while she and her husband work in bean farming. Maria has her own plot of land located just a few meters from her house where she grows beans and corn, which is and has been a source of income for her family. Her customers are the owners of small grocery stores and warehouses, and middlemen from the area around where she lives.  

One challenge that Maria faces is the lowering of prices in the market for her crops, and she hopes that prices will go up in the next days or months to earn a better income from her sales and improve her family's economic situation. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will help her to grow coffee and basic grains. She will also use the funds to buy certified corn seeds that she can plant. One of Maria's goals is to finish building her home, which needs work in order to be a safe place to live. She also wants to support her children's education so that they can graduate from high school and, she hopes, go on to college.

loans.use: buy farm supplies, care for her bean plantings, and buy corn seeds to plant.

loans.name: Ma Yan Village

texts.en:
This community is located in Ma Yan Village in Myanmar's Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. The Community Based Organization (CBO) consists of five committee members who oversee 17 village customers. This new loan would help the Ma Yan Village group members buy food for ducks (1 packet is $13, feeding 100 ducks for 5 days) and purchase more ducks. More ducks will increase income from more duck eggs.

Most of the villagers are famers, who especially do cropping. Some also plant seasonal food such as watermelons, beans and cucumbers. For extra income, they also raise livestock of pigs, ducks and cows. Pictured above are committee members from Ma Yan Village CBO. They are U Maung, U Myo, U Pho, U Myo and Daw Sein. 

U Maung (second from right) is 50 years old and is a farmer. He is married and lives together with his family of three. He especially does cropping and also raises ducks. Like his other fellow members, U Maung will use the loan to buy more food for ducks to enable more egg hatching, and command a higher price for his ducks.

loans.use: to help 17 villagers of Ma Yan Village Community to purchase ducklings and to buy high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Mahesh P Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Shantaben (at center in the photograph) is the 32-year-old mother of a teenager. She lives with her husband and in-laws in Gandhidham, a small town near the Gulf of Kutch in Gujarat. Taking advantage of the town’s bustling trade, owing to its proximity to the seaport of Kandla, Shantaben set up her own clothes-selling microenterprise. She sells traditionally embroidered dresses, covers, and handkerchiefs. She also sells ‘yokes’, which are beautifully embroidered cloth pieces used on the necks of ethnic tunics like the kameez and kurtis.

Through careful planning and hard work, Shantaben has grown her business to the point where it contributes almost 50% of her family’s income. Of this, she diligently saves Rs. 5,000 a month as a reserve for emergency expenses like medical bills and improvements to their living conditions. But most importantly, she saves for her child’s education. She wants to ensure that her child goes to college and has a chance at a better future.

To that end, Shantaben wants to grow her small business. She wants to source a wider variety of dresses, yokes, covers, and handkerchiefs in bulk. This will have a two-fold effect on her business: attracting more customers, and improving profit margins by letting her negotiate better rates with her suppliers. She forecasts a growth of Rs. 13,000 in her enterprise income, of which she will add Rs. 5,000 to double her personal savings, and will use the rest to further grow her microenterprise.

Shantaben needs capital, though, to carry out these plans for expansion. Since banks do not provide microfinance to borrowers like her, she formed a joint liability group, the Mahesh P Mahila Mandal 006, with four other industrious local women, to seek a loan of Rs. 100,000. With this loan, Shantaben will be able to realize her goals of earning more through her clothes-selling business. The other women, Rajuben, Nanbai, Ranbai, and Sarasvati, will use their share of the loan to similarly develop their respective snack selling, cloth selling, and furniture manufacturing small businesses.

Having married young, and hailing from a poor family, Shantaben did not have an opportunity to go to school. She understands very well how that can limit one’s ability to progress in life. So, educating her child is a goal very close to her heart. Your loan will help her execute the crucial plans she has to ensure this goal.

loans.use: to buy embroidered dresses, covers, yokes, and handkerchiefs as inventory towards growing her clothes-selling microenterprise.

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Cham province, Phallin is 35 years old. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one is too young for school. Nowadays, she can earn income to improve her family's living conditions via cassava growing on one hectare area and also by working for others for a fee (digging bananas) to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 20,100 KHR per day. 

This is Phallin's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to buy a horse to transport her cassava and bananas. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: To buy a horse to transport her rice and bananas.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Suma Warminaka Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA WARMINAKA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, venta de bisutería, tejido de mantas de alpaca, venta de salchipapa, venta de chompas de alpaca, tienda de barrio, venta de plasticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta y tejido de chompas de lana de alpaca; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por impulso de su madre, quien tenía el mismo negocio, posteriormente ella decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella esta casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group “Suma Warminaka” will start her 4th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focused center Santiago II, it's formed by 8 members and directed by a board where Sonia is the president.  The businesses that the members of the group work on are varied such as: fruit sales, jewelry sales, alpaca wool knitting, snack sales, alpaca wool sweaters sales, convenience store, plastic sales.  

The loan requested will benefit micro entrepreneurs where Sonia is a member, she mentions that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, starting with the invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business and knits sweaters made of alpaca wool. She indicates that this business was started several years ago with the support from her mother who had the same business.  Later on she decided to start her business independently.  

The loan that she will now take out is to increase working capital buy buying wool at wholesale.  She will buy it from the wholesale vendors at the city of La Paz and later she will sell it at her sale stand.  This activity allows her to generate income to support her family financially, she is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she indicates that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
MARÍA TERESA DE  SESENTA Y UN AÑO DE EDAD,  SOLTERA  CON UN HIJO MAYOR DE EDAD ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA,  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL,  POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO SEGUIR ESTUDIANDO, Y SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS  A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE  TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA EL SERVICIO DE COSTURA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN,  EJERCE SU ACTIVIDAD DESDE HACE VEINTIUNO AÑO, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA  DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO,  EL TIEMPO QUE DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO ES DE UNA DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS PARA PODER  CUMPLIR CON SUS CLIENTES Y MAS EN ESTA TEMPORADA DE PROMOCIONES Y NAVIDAD. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN MATERIALES DE COSTURA COMO : TELA, HILO, CINTAS, ACEITE DE MAQUINAS, AGUJAS, ENCAJES, BOTONES, FORROS, CINTA DE MANTEQUILLAS, BROCHES ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. MARÍA TERESA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDA A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 61 years old, single, and has a grown son. She is originally from Managua. María Teresa is known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. Due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to continue her studies. Therefore, she needed to work at an early age so that she could help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her drive to succeed, María Teresa was able to establish a business of providing sewing services in her home. She has been in business for 21 years and greatly enjoys her work. María Teresa spends about 10 hours a day completing orders for her customers, but she works longer hours during graduation season and at Christmas.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in sewing materials such as fabric, thread, ribbons, sewing machine oil, needles, lace, buttons, lining, satin ribbons, fasteners, and other supplies. In the near future, she will be able to generate better earnings. María Teresa appreciates the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can make a decent living.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, ribbons, sewing machine oil, needles, lace, buttons, lining, satin ribbons, fasteners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is about 39 years old and the mother of one child. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a while now, his rickshaw has not worked properly and this makes him unable to earn any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, but due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of making the repairs. That is why Rani has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of making these repairs and resuming his business. Rani is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 63 years old and a widow with eight children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 14 years and also earns an income from personal products.

Nenita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 28-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has 2 years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her first loan cycle with BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en: Melitona is single and earns a living by running a fruit-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 from NWTF to buy more fruit to sell. Melitona has been in this business for 20 years and her goal for the future is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Doris Orbelina

texts.es: Doris, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en una aldea del municipio de Tocoa, Colon. Lleva 10 años de haber establecido una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, pan, café, pastas, productos de aseo, harina, etc. este negocio es su fuente de ingresos donde a sostenido a su familia. ella solicita un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos y tener surtido el negocio, comprara granos básicos, harina, azúcar, manteca, embutidos, refrescos, churros, dulces y otros. Tiene como plan mejorar el negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doris is 35 years old, a single mother of 3 children, and they live in a village in Tocoa municipality in Colon. She has had a convenience store for 10 years, selling basic needs items such as rice, sugar, beans, butter, bread, coffee, pasta, canned goods, flour, etc. and this business is her source of income to support her family. She seeks a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy basic grains, flour, sugar, butter, canned goods, beverages, churros, candy, and other items to sell. She has a plan to to improve her business in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, flour, sugar, butter, canned goods, beverages, churros, candy, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen

texts.es:
REYNA DE 44 AÑOS DE EDAD, MADRE SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTA ESTUDIANDO EN PRIMARIA Y SECUNDARIA RESPECTIVAMENTE, ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA, DEDICA A SU FAMILIA, Y CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, DESDE MUY JOVEN APRENDIÓ EL NEGOCIO DE BELLEZA, EN LA ACTUALIDAD HA CRECIDO TANTO PROFESIONAL COMO ECONÓMICAMENTE GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN, TENACIDAD, Y PERSEVERANCIA.
EN LA ACTUALIDAD TIENE SU PROPIO SALÓN DE BELLEZA CON MUCHO ESFUERZO,  LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN LO DESPEÑA DESDE HACE QUINCE AÑOS, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO Y AMOR PORQUE LE GUSTA LO QUE HACE, Y LA FORMA DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA. POR LO TANTO ESTA SOLICITANDO UN FINANCIAMIENTO PARA AYUDARLE A LA COMPRA DE MATERIAL DE TRABAJO PARA PODER MANTENER SU CLIENTELA Y Y SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES Y SUS FUTUROS CLIENTES. Y COMPRA MATERIAL COMO: TINTES, CREMA HIDRATANTES, PINTURAS DE LABIOS, PINTURAS DE UÑAS, DESMAQUILLA DORAS, TRABAS, SECADORA, UNA PLANCHA DE PELO, ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS REYNA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 44-year old single mother who has two minor children, one of them in Elementary School and the other in Middle School. Originally from Managua, she is a very hard-working woman who does everything for her family and has a strong will of self-improvement. She learned the business of beauty when she was very young and now has grown professionally and financially thanks to her self-improvement will and persistence. She currently has her own beauty salon in her house. She has ran the business for 15 years and enjoys her job and the way of life of her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy material, keep her clients and meet current and future demand. She will buy dyes, moisturizers, lipsticks, nail polishes, make-up removers, dryers, hair straighteners, etc. so that she can have better income. Reyna is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy working materials, such as dyes, moisturizers, lipsticks, nail polishes, make-up removers, dryers, hair straighteners, etc.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Daoudabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, bazins, pagnes wax et brodés. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme arrêtée en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de bazins. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 16m de bazins riche et 10m de bazins moins riche en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Daoudabougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
For the most part, the six members of the Danaya group are married in monogamous relationships. On average, they are 50 years old and have four children. They all live in Daoudabougou, a neighborhood in Bamako. They know one another through neighbors and their revenue generating activities in Daoudabougou. The group members sell damask, pagnes wax (traditional wraparounds), and embroidery. 

With the goal of increasing their business assets, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their 1st group loan.

Madame Aminata (third woman from the right) is an important damask saleswoman. She would like to use her loan to buy 16 meters of expensive damask and 10 meters of less-expensive damask at wholesale prices in Bamako. She resells for retail prices in Daoudabougou to a clientele comprised mainly of women. 

Madame Aminata would like to earn an average monthly income 40,000 FCFA that she’ll use to reinvest in her business and meet the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Laloifi

texts.en: Laloifi is a 17-year-old lady, who runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this since last year. Laloifi has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bags, and a Coolio to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in her community. Laloifi became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bags, and a Coolio

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo es un hombre de 52 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos 2 niñas de 11 y 13 años y 2 varones de 12 y 20 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar con su negocio de venta de crianza y venta de pollos actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años. Gonzalo desea construir un cuarto de lámina en su vivienda que le permita tener una mayor comodidad ya que siente que actualmente vive en hacinamiento junto a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir un cuarto en su vivienda, sabiendo que podrá cubrir las cuotas necesarias de este crédito con su negocio ya que sabe que en la temporada navideña sus productos tienen mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a 52-year-old man who resides in his own home along with his wife and their four children. He has two daughters (ages 11 and 13) and two sons (ages 12 and 20). Gonzalo is an enterprising man who strives to sustain the household finances through his business of raising and selling chickens. He has been in this line of work for eight years.

Gonzalo wants to build a room made of metal sheets in his home, which will provide greater comfort since his family is currently living in overcrowded conditions. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in galvanized sheets, wood, and nails for building a room in his house. Gonzalo knows that he will be able to cover his loan payments because his products are in greater demand during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails so that he can build a room in his house.

loans.name: Dulce Nombre Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Dulce Nombre lo integran tres mujeres con espíritu de superación, quien lo coordina es Lilliam que tiene la edad de 26 años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, por quienes lucha cada día para brindarles los recursos necesarios para su alimentación y educación, se dedica a la comercialización de gaseosas, chiverías, platanitos y ropa, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pantalones para damas, caballeros, camisetas, gaseosas desechables, big cola, etc., de este modo podrá diversificar los productos ofrecidos. Otro integrante es María Eugenia una mujer de 43 años de edad, ofrece el servicio de costura y venta de comida en su domicilio y la señora Maritza que tiene la edad de 48 años propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años.
texts.en: The Dulce Nombre group consists of three women with the spirit to succeed. Lilliam is the coordinator; she is 26 years old, married, and mother of two children for whom she fights every day to provide them the resources necessary to feed and education them. She sells soda pop, snacks, small silver items and clothing. She seeks a loan to buy pants for women and men, t-shirts, soda pop, etc. and in this way be able to diversity the products she sells. Another member is 43 year old Maria Eugenia who offers seamstress services and sells food from her home; and 48 year old Maritza who has owned a convenience store for 3 years.

loans.use: to buy soda pop, clothing, and candy.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old with five children. With one child in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell.

Gina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 51 years old and married with three children.

Noeme works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Noeme has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from selling seashells.

Noeme aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
Melrose is 43 years old and is married with three children who are in school. Melrose works very hard to provide for her family.

Melrose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000  PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Melrose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 29 years old. She is single and has a 16-year-old son. She has been a Zoona mobile money transfer operator for six months. In October, Mercy used Kiva funds to purchase a Zoona branded trading booth. She is making good repayments on her Kiva loan and now hopes to get a new Kiva loan so that she can have essential transaction cash needed for her to grow her business.

Prior to running her own business, Mercy studied hotel management and held several jobs. She started her own company because she believes that her mobile money business is very useful for families in her community. Mercy’s customers come from all walks of life, though the majority of them are unbanked.

The Kiva loan will help Mercy to serve customers who need to send and receive money from her shop. She will also be able to purchase another trading booth so that she can open another outlet in an area called Panganani in Lusak. Mercy thanks her lenders and would like to let them know that the profits from her business help her to provide basic needs for her and her son.

loans.use: to purchase a another trading booth and serve customers who need to send and receive money from her shop.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 50 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Fe is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Fe has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Fe is committed to rebuilding, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like condiments, canned goods, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is 30, married, and lives with her husband and three children in Lahore, Pakistan. She earns a living by selling clothing at home. She buys these clothes from a market for a low price and sells it for a higher one in her community. The women who live in her area like her garment collection and her family members appreciate her hard work. Now that winter is about to start, Mumtaz wants to buy warmer clothing to sell, but lacks sufficient funds due to this because of high household expenses.  She has requested a loan so that she can meet customer demand by buying winter clothing. She is very grateful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell from her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Medilen

texts.en:
Medilen engages in a buy and sell business. She sells rice on a retail basis. She is a married woman with two children aged 16 and 14 years old respectively. Her husband earns a living by farming. He grows and sells rice. To augment her income, she also raises and sells hogs.

Medilen is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice, additional pigs and pig feed. In this way, her hog raising business will improve, thus producing more healthy pigs to sell. She could now start selling a variety of rice to her customers. This will create a higher impact on her day-to-day income. She can now pay household expenses and be able to pay the instalments of her loan.

Medilen dreams to expand her business to make it successful, and provide a source of stable income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, additional pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Ebenezer "2" Group

texts.es: Damaris del Socorro es una mujer que a sus 44 años no ha perdido sus ganas de superarse en la vida y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha concentrado su tiempo y pasión en un negocio de floristería artesanal, del cual lleva 14 años de experiencia entregando su producto en la capital del país, de este negocio obtiene los resultados y las ganancias para el pago del financiamiento con ADIM y mantener su familia que consta de sus tres hijos ya que es una mujer soltera q lucha día a día en busca del éxito, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de fomy, alambres, hilos de colores, bandeja de plásticos, poroplast, etc. El resto de las integrantes son María Daysi quien tiene la edad de 55 años y es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años, Audlia de 44 años de edad comercializa frutas y verduras en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace doce años, y Teresa de 21 años de edad dedicada a la hecha y venta de tortillas desde hace un año en su domicilio.
texts.en: Damaris del Socorro is a 44 year old woman who has not lost her desire to be successful in life and with great effort and dedication she has focused her time and passion in an artisan artificial flower making business. She has had this business for 14 years delivering her product to the country's capital. She has had good results and profits from this business to pay the financing with ADIM and support her family which consists of 3 children as she is a single mother who fights every day for success. This loan will be used to buy materials to create artificial flowers including foams, forms, materials, colored thread, plastic wrap, wire, etc. to enable her to increase production in her business. The other members of the group are Maria Daysi who at 55 years old has had a convenience store for 3 years; Audilia is 44 years old and has sold fruits and vegetables in the municipal market for 12 years; Teresa is 21 years old and has been making and selling tortillas from her home for a year.

loans.use: to buy materials to create artificial flowers including foams, forms, materials, wire, etc. to enable her to increase production in her business.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Julita works very hard to provide for her family.

Julita sells personal products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of products to sell like perfume, body lotion, etc.

Julita has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Julita would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of products to sell like perfume, body lotion, etc.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
In the heart of the copperbelt province of Zambia lies Mufulira district. A small town located 16 km from the border of the Democratic Republic of Congo. This is where Theresa owns her mobile money transfer business. She is 26 years old and comes from a family of six. 

She has a diploma in Production & Operations Management. Once her business starts to make more profit, she plans to pursue a degree in her course, because she believes that a good education is important in life. Theresa has been running her business for 3 months now. She loves her business because it is able to provide money to customers who urgently need the money and it puts a smile on their faces. When asked what challenges she faces in her business, Theresa says that transportation of cash to and from the bank is very difficult because her location is not very secure. She says once she gets the Kiva loan, she will not have to move cash with her because she will have a good enough working capital and it will be much easier to go about her day-to-day business. 

The Kiva loan will help Theresa to hire one person to help in her shop. She says it will also help her to add to her working capital so that she does not have to constantly carry cash to and from the bank. Theresa asks Kiva lenders to help her increase her working capital, serve more customers, and earn more profits. She plans to save her profits so that she can open a second Zoona mobile money transfer shop soon.

loans.use: to employ one person and add on the funds that she uses to serve her customers.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora está en su ciclo número 3° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirian quien es peluquera, es muy buena en lo que hace, y se ha formado ya una muy buena clientela, que siempre va hasta su salón para poder recibir su servicio. Ella quiere seguir creciendo para poder seguir dando a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, tintes, cremas, enjuagues, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Maria Auxiliadora in in the third cycle of the women's committee program in which all of them work and help each other get ahead. They are doing the elimination of poverty survey in order to understand each of their situations so it will guide them as they work and improve their situation. 

One of the members is Mirian who is a hairdresser. She does her job very well and has many clients who always go to her salon for her service. She wants to continue growing so she can give her family all that she couldn't have. She is asking for a loan to buy products for her hair salon like shampoos, dyes, crams, rinses, and other things so she can keep working as she has been.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, dyes, creams, rinses,  and other products

loans.name: Reyna Julissa

texts.es: Las buenas relaciones humanas y la atención al cliente así como la publicidad y distribución de productos es lo que le ha llamado la atención a Reyna, es por esta razón que decidió estudiar mercadeo y publicidad. A sus 22 cursa el tercer año de la carrera, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres. Para seguir rindiendo en sus estudios y entregar los trabajos asignados a tiempo, Reyna solicita un crédito para comprar una laptop. De esta manera culminara sus estudios profesionales y podrá desempeñarse en el campo laboral.
texts.en:
Good human relations and customer service as well as advertising and product distribution caught Reyna's attention, so she decided to study marketing and advertising.  Thanks to her effort and her parents' support, she's in the third year of her program.

Reyna's requesting a loan to buy a laptop so she can keep on doing well in her studies and turn in her assigned work on time.  That way she'll finish her professional program and be able to start working in the field.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Juntas Venceremos Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Juntas Venceremos lo integran tres socios que se esfuerzan por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, quien lo coordina es la señora Namilet de 34 años de edad, acompañada, ofrece el servicio de venta de comida rápida y ropa nueva en uno de los centro de salud de su municipalidad, este negocio lo impulsó hace ocho años con esfuerzo de ella, es el cuarto ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio, este último crédito lo invertirá en la compra de camisetas, blúmer, brazier, sandalias, marucham, azúcar, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos mejorando de gran manera los ingresos percibidos por su negocio. Al grupo también lo integran la señora Milagros de 38 años de edad propietaria de una mini pulpería desde hace cuatro años, y el señor Wilfredo de 54 años de edad, quien vende refresco en su domicilio desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Juntas Venceremos [Together We Will Overcome], has three members who work hard to improve their families’ living conditions.  It is coordinated by Señora Namilet, age 34, who is in a relationship.  

She offers fast-food service and sells new clothing in one of the health centers in her municipality--a business that she launched eight years ago through her hard work. 

This is her fourth cycle with ADIM, which has provided her with loans for her business.  She will invest the latest loan in the purchase of t-shirts, underwear, bras, sandals, instant noodles, sugar, etc.  With the previous loans, she was able to offer a greater variety of products and greatly improve her business’s earnings.  

The group also includes Señora Milagros, age 38, who has owned a small grocery store for four years, and Señor Wilfredo, age 54, who has been selling soft drinks from his home for three years.

loans.use: to purchase instant noodles, oil, green plantains, cabbage, t-shirts, tights, underwear, etc., which will help her to keep improving her work.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Nièta est constitué de cinq (5) femmes  tous mariées et vie uniquement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de, restaurant, pâtes d’arachides et habits.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 3ème   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de restaurant.  Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de riz et 2 sacs de mil. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine. La revente s’effectue à  Djicoroni  au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Nièta group is comprised of five women who are all in monogamous marriages. On average, they are 34 years old and have four children. 

They all live in Djicoroni, a neighborhood in Bamako. They know one another from the neighborhood and through their revenue-generating activities. The group members sell groceries, peanut butter, and clothing. With the goal of increasing their business assets, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. This is their third group loan.

Madame Fatou (seated at right in the photo) is a well-known grocer.  She would like to use her loan to buy three bags of rice and two bags of millet. They buy their supplies in Médine and sell their goods in Djicoroni for cash to a clientele comprised mainly of women. Madame Fatou would like to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 FCFA, which she’ll use to meet the needs of her children. She will invest the rest in her business. 

Madame relies heavily on her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to achieve her goal of growing her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Ngoza

texts.en:
26-year-old Ngoza has continued to grow her mobile money business. She explains that the business has given her a lot of opportunities and the financial stability to pay for her education.

Ngoza is a very energetic and hardworking individual. She enjoys her business because she gets to interact with different people and help her community by employing youth and providing a much needed service. She currently employs two young adults to help with the business' day-to-day operations. Ngoza is grateful to all her Kiva lenders for the financial support. She would like to let them know that her first Kiva loan helped her to serve more customers at her business by increasing her cash flow. With this additional capital, she was able to increase her profits and is ready to expand the business by opening another Zoona outlet in the capital city of Lusaka. 

Ngoza is requesting a second Kiva loan to grow her mobile money business to service more customers in her community who need financial services. The money is used to serve the customers' money transfer needs. Ngoza is confident that once she begins to operate from the new location she will earn enough profits to continue paying for her school and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To grow her mobile money business to service more customers in her community who need financial services

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a 53-year-old lady. Her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband owns a furniture shop in which he makes wooden accessories, such as sofas, chairs and beds. He has been making furniture for many years and teaching his art to his son as well. Now the son has become a fine carpenter and can easily run a separate business, so he newly established a shop. Now he wants to buy his all tools and raw materials for making furniture. Therefore, Khalida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy raw materials and tools for making furniture. 

Khalida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw material and tools for her son's newly established carpenter shop.

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: Esta señora trabaja como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde habita, además tiene otra actividad comercial como es una pequeña pulpería como fuente alternativa de ingresos, es casada, con un hijo a su cargo, al que le brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo académico, actualmente tiene la urgencia de realizar una mejora a su vivienda y otra inversión, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar   financiamiento el que utilizaría en   Mejora de cocina, compra de inodoro, y un poco de granos básicos para reforzar el inventario de una pulpería, lo que le vendría a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Felicita works as a primary school teacher at a school in the area where she lives. She also has another business, a small grocery store, as an alternative source of income. She is married with a son in her care; she provides him with all of the support necessary for his academic development. She currently needs to make improvements to her home and to make another investment.

For this reason she visited CEPRODEL to ask for financing that she will use to improve her kitchen and to buy a toilet and a bit of basic grains to reinforce the inventory of a small grocery store. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her kitchen and to buy a toilet and a bit of basic grains to reinforce the inventory of a small grocery store

loans.name: Denis Francisco

texts.es:
DENIS DE 40 ANOS DE EDAD, CASADO CON DOS HIJOS  MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO EN PRIMARIA Y SECUNDARIA RESPECTIVAMENTE, ES ORIGINARIO DE MANAGUA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE NO TERMINO SUS ESTUDIOS  Y SE DEDICO A TRABAJAR CON SU PADRE QUIEN LE ENSEÑO EL OFICIO DE ENDEREZADO Y PINTURA. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA PARA SACAR ADELANTE EL NEGOCIO  Y PROPORCIONARLE A SUS HIJOS LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA QUE NECESITAN.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN  DESDE HACE VEINTE Y DOS AÑOS QUE DESEMPEÑA DICHO NEGOCIO, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN MATERIAL  Y TRABAJO Y CONDICIONARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES PARA SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES ,HACER CRECER EL NEGOCIO Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. DENIS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO  ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Denis, 40, is married and has two minor children who are in elementary and secondary school.  He's from Managua and is known for being hardworking and responsible with a great desire for self-improvement.

Unfortunately, Denis didn't finish school; he started working with his father, who taught him bodywork and painting.  Currently he's striving to make progress with his business and give his children the financial stability they need.  Thanks to his desire for self-improvement, his business has been located in his home.  He has worked in the business for 22 years.

The goal of the loan is to invest in materials and better work conditions to satisfy his customer demand, make his business grow, and earn more income in the near future.

Denis is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have the means to a decent job.

loans.use: to buy materials for vehicle bodywork and painting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labour cost on the farm

loans.name: Dúo Luchando Por Nuestros Sueños Group

texts.es:
Dúo Luchando por Nuestros Sueños 
La señora Francisca es la encargada de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de ropa típica como güipiles, blusas de tela, fajas bordadas, delantales, cortes típicos de diferente calidad y colores, algunos suéteres desde hace 8 años y es vendedora ambulante. Siendo viuda lucha con mucha alegría al lado de sus dos hijos que a su corta edad de 22 y 20 años son microempresarios y le agradece a Dios por ayudarla cada día.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo en el negocio, teniendo un lugar especifico para vender y alcanzar sus sueños la cual es una casa más grande y hermosa, tiene varios pedidos de cortes típicos en colores y calidad pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por eso necesita otro préstamo para no quedarle mal a sus compradoras.
texts.en:
Francisca is the leader of this group, which for the past 8 years has worked in the sale of clothing such as traditional Guatemalan blouses, embroidered belts, aprons, traditional cuts of fabric of different qualities and colors, and sweaters. She is a street vendor. As a widow, she fights with much happiness alongside her two children, who at the young ages of 20 and 22, are micro-entrepreneurs. She gives thanks to God every day for helping her.

Her dream is to continue growing her business, to have her own place to make her sales, and to achieve her dream of having a larger and more beautiful house. She has several orders in place for various pieces, but the money she has available is insufficient; therefore, she needs this loan so she doesn't make a bad impression on her customers.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to produce traditional clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kitchen equipment to start her catering business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 36, continues to grow his Zoona mobile money business because he has access to working capital through Kiva. He has been running the business for two years. He lives in a rented house with his wife Kombe.

This is Stephen’s second Kiva loan application. He used his first loan to serve customers by increasing his working capital at his Zoona outlet. The increase allowed him to better serve his customers. He says it also helped him increase his profits.

Today, Stephen continues in his quest to provide good service to his customers. He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him finance his business. He will use the loan to serve customers who need to transact at his trading booth. He explains that the business of mobile money transfers is highly dependent on how much money one has in the business. Having more money in the business will enable Stephen to serve more customers and earn more profits. He relies on the profits to provide for his customers.

Stephen would like to take this opportunity to thank his lenders for their support. Stephen does not have the opportunity to access a bank loan because he does not have any collateral. The funding from Kiva is the sole source he has to access capital so he can continue to grow his business and support his family.

loans.use: To serve customers who need to transact at his trading booth

loans.name: Ignacio Enrique

texts.es: Ignacio es un microempresario que tiene la edad de 50 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él, es propietario de un taller de zapatería, es primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM para aumentar la producción de su taller, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cuero sintético, pega blanca, pega amarilla, suelas, cajuelas, conos de hilos, etc., de esta manera aumentará la producción y mejorarán sus ingresos, permitiéndoles pagar sus cuotas en el período estipulado
texts.en:
Ignacio is a small entrepreneur. He is 50 years old, married, and the father of two dependent children. Ignacio is the owner of a shoemaking shop. This is the first loan he has requested from ADIM so that he can increase production at his workshop.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy synthetic leather, white glue, yellow glue, soles, heels, cones of thread, and other supplies so that he can increase his production and improve his earnings. As a result, Ignacio will be able to submit his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy synthetic leather, white glue, yellow glue, soles, heels, cones of thread, and other shoemaking supplies

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive el señor  Miguel, tiene 19 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de los padres. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. El estudia en un colegio de la localidad.
Don Miguel  es un joven  muy trabajador que le gusta ganarse lo suyo para ayudar a sus padres y para seguir con sus estudios ya que él quiere es ser un profesional, él para ganarse la vida realiza cortes de cabellos y también vende productos  Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, cremas, perfumería y bisuterías), lo realiza en sus ratos libres, el recorrer la ciudad visitando sus clientes y también  realiza sus trabajos en su casa, lleva 4 meses con esta actividad la cual comenzó con uno de los créditos por lo cual está muy agradecido. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar herramientas que aun necesita y productos de Yanbal. Sus sueños son ser profesional y tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro loan group meets once every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known nationally and internationally; it is the place where the famous Panama hats are made.

Miguel lives in this place; he is 19 years old, is single and lives in his parents' house. This is his second cycle in the loan group and he likes it because the loans help him a lot. He is studying at a high school in his area. Miguel is a hardworking young man who likes to earn his own money to help his parents and to continue with his studies, as he wants to be a professional. To earn a living he does haircuts and also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, creams, perfumes and jewelry). He does this in his free time, running around the city visiting his customers, and he also works from his home. He has had this business for four months and he started it with one of the loans, for which he is very grateful. 

He is going to use this loan to buy tools he still needs and Yanbal products. His dreams are to be a professional and to have a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy tools and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Pacifica is 57 years old, is married with one child and lives at Sibutad, Sapang Dalaga. Their source of income comes from their “carenderia” (small restaurant). She is the one who manages it & her husband is the cook.  

She joined Paglaum MPC just this year because of its benefits given to members. She has applied for 3,000 PHP to buy additional kitchen utensils. She looks forward to someday owning a sari-sari with a restaurant and videoke bar.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen utensils for her carenderia.

loans.name: Juanilla

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Juanilla works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Juanilla is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Juanilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 24-year-old micro-entrepreneur. She lives in a rented house in Kafue with her two-year-old daughter. She recently expanded her Zoona business after opening a new mobile money transfer shop in her town of Kafue.

This is Tamara’s third loan. She used the money from her first loan to increase her working capital so that she could serve her customers who wanted to send larger amounts of money. She says the loan was very helpful in growing her business as she is now able to serve more customers who come to send and receive money and she no longer has to turn them away. She then got a second loan to help open a new outlet by purchasing a Zoona branded trading booth. Her earnings have improved and she is excited about the growth of her business. She has even employed two more people to help her run the two outlets.

Tamara is taking out a subsequent loan for her new shop in Kafue. The loan will be used as working capital float for her new outlet. Right now, the new Kafue shop is working on a minimal working capital float of $1,000. This is not enough to satisfy the growing customer base in the thriving town. The loan will help Tamara grow her business and provide for her daughter.

loans.use: To provide essential transaction cash needed for her to serve her customers and grow her business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell spare parts business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of spare parts to sell for her buy-and-sell spare parts business.

Ofelia has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from a car wash.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives on a hilltop in Kenyenya, Kenya with her husband and their two children. From her small, but immaculately clean mud house, she can see a lush valley full of maize, tomatoes, beans, and vegetables. She can also see a bright future, thanks to the income she earns through practicing mixed farming. Ruth passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows . Because of the immense farming knowledge, she has turned her farmland into an open university. Here, hundreds turn up to get trained in the hope that they will replicate her model on their own farmland. However the biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. She believes that through the loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions and be able to secure the future of her children. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and she will be able to pay back the loan. Ruth is confident that if you invest in her dream you will be impacting the life of her family and children.

Please consider lending to Ruth.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is an ambitious 27-year-old woman. Born second in a family of five, her mother and father are subsistence farmers. Tina operates two Zoona mobile money transfer outlets in Chongwe, Zambia, to earn an income and take care of her family.

Tina has been operating her business for almost three years now. This is her third Kiva loan. Her first loan came in February of 2012, right when she was starting her business. The loan was used to purchase a trading booth, which she uses to serve her customers. She says this helped her business receive new customers because of the Zoona branding on the booth, which helps build trust in the community. Tina then got a second loan to open her second outlet.

Currently, Tina is seeking a third loan so she can fund her two existing shops by increasing the money she uses to serve her customers at both outlets. She will also hire a new employee to assist with running the new outlet.

Tina is hopeful that adding more money to her two outlets will double her current profits. She explains how the cost of running a business is very expensive. A lot of her revenue goes to paying land rates where her booth is placed. Tina is looking to continue to expand her business so she can earn more income and provide better for her family.

loans.use: To fund her two existing shops by increasing the money she uses to serve her customers at her two outlets

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, comenta que su meta es poder desarrollar su propia empresa, y poder dar trabajo a muchos jóvenes que necesitan.
Esta esforzándose para poder ser un buen profesional, y así sentirse útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, como así también poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte.
texts.en:
Ramon is from the city of Carapeguá. He is studying for a degree in Systems Analysis. Ramon says that his goal is to develop his own company so that he can provide jobs to many young people who need them.

He is striving to become a successful professional so that he can feel useful to society. Ramon is requesting this loan so that he can pay his university fees and also cover his transportation expenses.

loans.use: to pay his university fees and cover his transportation expenses.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, comenta haber tenido una experiencia positiva con la inversión del préstamo anterior en su negocio, pues la elaboración y comercialización de hamacas está teniendo mayor demanda entre sus clientes nuevos, sus nuevas ganancias son utilizadas para cancelar su deuda, cubrir necesidades familiares y remodelar un poco su  vivienda.
El nuevo crédito que está solicitando le será de utilidad para comprar hilos, agujas y también pagara obreros que le ayuden a continuar elaborando hamacas, solo así seguirá teniendo ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Santos says he has had a positive experience with the investment of the previous loan in his business.  Since making and marketing the hammocks he is having a greater demand among his new customers.  His new profits are used for paying his debt, covering family needs, and remodeling his house a little.

The new loan that he is requesting will be useful to him to buy thread, needles, and he will also pay the workers that help him to continue making hammocks.  Only then will he continue having the income to meet his commitments.

loans.use: To buy thread, needles, and he will also pay the workers that help him to continue making hammocks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials to make garments to sell

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam, a 33-year-old mother of six, lives in a rural area near Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small restaurant offering a variety of delicious foods twice a day. 

In business for four years and earning good profits, Neelam's husband now wants to improve his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron, etc. Due to household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy the desired items, so Neelam has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She thanks Kiva and appreciates its warm support for her.

loans.use: To buy new plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron, etc. for her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador tiene 39 años de edad, esta soltero, vive solo en su casa en una aldea del municipio de las Flores, Lempira. Toda la vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y hace 10 años cultiva granos básicos para la venta, produce maíz y frijoles y esta producción la vende en los mercados de la zona. Ha solicitado dos préstamos a la institución con el actual que es por 6,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar abonos y fertilizantes para realizar un nuevo cultivo de maíz y frijol y poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su plan es ampliar la plantación para obtener mejores ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Salvador is 39 years old, single, and lives alone at his house in a neighborhood in the town of Flores, Lempira. His entire life has been devoted to agriculture and he has spent the last 10 years cultivating basic staples to sell. He produces corn and beans and then sells his products at the local markets.

Salvador has requested two loans from ODEF and his current loan is in the amount of 6,000 HNL. He will use the money to buy compost and fertilizers for a new crop of corn and beans, which will help him achieve a better harvest. His plan is to expand his farm so that he can generate better sales and earnings.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for a new crop of corn and beans.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed plantation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Marina is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed, plastic rope, empty bottles, etc. for her seaweed plantation business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed, plastic rope, empty bottles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her husband's general store.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is 30 years old. He lives in a rented house with his wife Yvonne and their two young children, Luwi, 5, and Holenu, 2.  Sunday works very hard to support his family. He works full time as a driver and equipment loader for one of the mining companies in Luanshya, Zambia. He recently started running a Zoona mobile money transfer business so that he would be able to provide for his family as his salary was not enough to meet their needs.

Sunday describes his business as a safe way for people in his community to move their monies from one place to the other, without having to go to the banks, which most of his customers find intimidating. He likes running the business because it is a decent way to earn a living and he is able to work full time while running it. Sunday has employed one person to work as a teller at his shop. 

Sunday has requested his first loan so that he can purchase the trading booth that he is currently using. The trading booth costs ZMK 6,400. He will use the other ZMK 5,000 to serve customers by adding to his float. Right now, Sunday operates with a minimum working capital of ZMK 1,000, as he did not have a lot of money to invest in the business. This money is barely enough to serve customers. His teller constantly has to make trips to the bank to convert the electronic into cash and vise versa. This makes Sunday lose a lot of business as he is forced to leave the booth unattended while they look for cash.

This loan will help Sunday to have money to serve his customers more efficiently.  He is hopeful that once he starts earning good profits, he can send his wife Yvonne back to school, so that she can get a good education.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona branded trading booth and provide essential funds for him to serve people in need of financial services in his community

loans.name: Claudia Lucia

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer esforzada, de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 12 años de laborar, es madre soltera, con 2 hijos a su cargo a los que le  da el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente tiene la urgencia de mejorar la vivienda, por lo que visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de cemento,  arena, zinc y mano de obra con lo que mejorara el cuarto como es reparando una pared y parte del techo, para crear mejores condiciones de vida familiar
texts.en:
Claudia is a hard-working woman who has been a primary school teacher for 12 years.  She is a single mother who takes care of her two children, giving them all of the support they need in order to grow.

She urgently needs to improve her home, so she visited Ceprodel to request financing.  She will use it to purchase cement, sand, and zinc; and to pay for labor to improve a room in which she is repairing a wall and part of the roof, in order to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and zinc, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Virgen del Pilar, está formado por 18  integrantes, están  en el ciclo 11 del programa de comité de mujeres. Se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder conocer su situación de vida y poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra .Flavia, quien se dedica a la venta de mercería en su propia casa y esto con la ayuda de  sus hijos. La Sra. Flavia es una persona muy trabajadora, que con lucha y sacrificio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y a sus seres queridos, ella sueña con poder seguir creciendo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Flavia solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para la venta, como ser prendas, calzados y demás, y con ello poder seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named “Virgen del Pilar” consists of 18 members. They are in their 11th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. In addition, they are participating in the poverty elimination program so that they can become familiar with their life situation and be able to work.

One of the members is Sra. Flavia. She sells dry goods out of her home, which allows her to support her children. Sra. Flavia is a hardworking individual who strives and sacrifices so that her family and loved ones can get ahead. She dreams to keep growing and improving her living conditions.

Sra. Flavia is requesting a loan in order to buy various products to sell such as clothes, shoes, and other items. This will enable her to continue fulfilling orders from her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: Xiomara es una señora dedicada a impartir clases a nivel secundario en un colegio de la zona, es casada, con un hijo a su cargo, al que le brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo académico, actualmente tiene la urgencia de seguir mejorando su vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la   Compra de cemento, arena, Bloques y mano de obra, para terminar de construir una  tapia, lo que le vendría a dar  más seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara is a secondary school teacher at a local school. She is married with one dependent child, and she is giving her child all the support that is  necessary for his academic development.

At this time she urgently needs to continue improving her home, so she visited CEPRODEL to request a loan. She will use it to buy cement, sand and bricks, as well as to pay for the manual labor to finish constructing a wall that will improve the security of her family home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and to pay for manual labor to finish constructing a wall.

loans.name: Dúo Tierras Bendecidas Group

texts.es: Dúo Tierras Bendecidas El encargado de este dúo es el señor Lauro quien se dedica a la siembra y venta de rosas de primera, segunda y tercera calidad. Tiene sus cultivos desde hace 36 años y es un conocimiento heredado de sus padres.  Su esposa le ayuda grandemente porque se encarga de la venta en el mercado y también tienen cría de patos, gallinas, chompipes, gansos.  Sus hijos e hijas están cursando la universidad y eso es la motivación de seguir luchando para alcanzar su mayor sueño que es verlos graduados. La próxima cosecha se aproxima y los cultivos necesitan ser abonados y protegidos por las plagas, por ello necesita un préstamo para comprar los productos que necesita como el abono por quintal como el 20-20 -0, 15-15-15, y litros de fertilizantes como el Adherente, Dithane y otros.  Por eso necesita nuevamente otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta y abonar la tierra y tener una cosecha hermosa.
texts.en: The Tierras Bendecidas duo - Lauro is in charge of this duo. He works growing and selling roses of first, second and third quality.  He has had his crops for the past 36 years and it is knowledge inherited from his parents. His wife helps him a lot because she is responsible for market sales and also they raise ducks, chickens, turkeys, and geese. His sons and daughters are in university and this is his motivation for continuing to fight to achieve his greatest dream, which is to see them graduate. The next harvest is approaching and his crops need to be fertilized and protected from pests. For this, he needs a loan to purchase the products that he needs such as manure by the quintal [approximately 100 pounds] such as 20-20-0 and 15-15-15, and liters of fertilizers such as Adherente, Dithane and others. Fro this reason he needs another loan to purchase what he lacks and fertilize the land and have a beautiful crop.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to cultivate flowers for sale.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de comunicación social.
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida con sus estudios, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en una universidad privada ubicada en la zona ‘Central’ de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, como; universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura variable entre 4-21 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no utiliza porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a su madre que trabaja como comerciante y tiene 3 hermanas menores que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de luz, agua y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de comunicación social y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta estudiando los procesos comunicacionales existentes en cada ámbito social, le gusta la composición de la imagen, su carácter es muy sociable. Su sueño es ser profesional para trabajar en un canal de televisión y desea realizar la compra de material fotográfico como; cámara, trípode, luces y otros, para terminar su carrera profesional con la especialidad de fotografía. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica al estudio profesional.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de fotografía y  terminar su carrera con la especialidad de fotografía.
texts.en:
Maria is a 20-year-old woman, single, without children, and is studying social communication.

She is intelligent, responsible, committed to her studies, dependable, sweet, loving, sensitive and sincere. She is studying at a private university located in the "Central" zone of the city, an area characterized by commerce of all types such as universities, public offices and private businesses, which coexist side by side, with a cold and dry climate with a variable temperature between 4-21 degrees centigrade during the day, year-round.

Maria has tanned skin and has long black hair styled fashionably. Her native language is Aymará, which she doesn't use because she studies and lives in the city. She shares her life with her mother who works as a saleswoman and has 3 younger sisters who go to school. They live in their own house which has electricity, water, and sewer services. She is studying for a social communication degree and is year 2 of 5 for that program.  She enjoys studying the existing communication processes in each social environment, she likes composition of images, and she has a very social character.

Her dream is to be a professional to work in a television studio and she wants to purchase photographic equipment such as camera, tripod, lights and others, to finish her professional degree with a specialization in photography. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the 2 years that she has been studying her profession.

For these reasons, Maria asks for a loan to purchase photographic equipment and finish her program with a specialization in photography.

loans.use: to purchase photographic equipment and finish her program with a specialization in photography.

loans.name: Dúo El Carmen Group

texts.es:
Duo el Carmen.
Alejandra es casada tiene 5 hijos se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su domicilio ubicado en el Carmen, inicio su negocio hace 5 años en el cual ella se siente muy satisfecha porque tiene un trabajo y por que puede darle trabajo a mas mujeres luchadoras como ella,  se siente  muy contenta por el apoyo que tiene en Fape para poder seguir trabajando en su negocio, y darle a sus hijos una buena educación,  anhela terminar de pagar su lote para tener una casa propia, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para elaboracion de tortillas, esperando que le puedan seguir apoyando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Duo El Carmen Group
Alejandra is married with 5 children. She makes a living selling tortillas in her home located in El Carmen. She started her business 5 years ago and she is very happy with it because she has a job and she can offer work to other hardworking women like her.
