She is very happy for the support provided by Fape which allows her to continue working in her business, and give her children a good education. She dreams of paying off her block of land to have her own home. She is requesting this loan to purchase corn to make tortillas, and hopes that she will continue to receive support in her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn in order to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia, 57 years old, is married and has three children. For the past 12 years, Ofelia has been farming rice in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Ofelia has successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and farm supplies. Ofelia works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 51 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. Aside from this business she is also running a general store to have ans additional income.

Melanie has been buying and selling livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of assorted vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Corazon has been in this business for 16 years. Corazon earns more income from motorcycle transport and farming sugarcane.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of assorted vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmen is 56 years old and all of her children are in school.

Carmen has a buy and sell of jewelry business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy jewelry to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 54 years old and single.  

Cornelia is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Cornelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cornelia has been in pig fattening for six years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Cornelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer  comenta que su mayor aspiración es ser una profesional competente, útil a su familia y la sociedad.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, por medio de su carrera quiere ir abriéndose camino y ser una excelente profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jennifer says that her greatest aspiration is to become a competent professional and be useful to her family and to society. She is studying for a degree in Accounting. With her degree, she wants to go down the path toward becoming an excellent professional.

Jennifer is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees. This will enable her to continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Katherine Celeste

texts.es:
KATHERINE DE 21 ANOS DE EDAD, MADRES SOLTERA CON UN HIJO DE TRES AÑOS  DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIA DE LEÓN,  ESTA JOVEN  MADRES SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, CON GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE Y LUCHAR  POR SU HIJO  PARA BRINDARLES LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, EMOCIONAL QUE EL SE MERECE. COMO MADRE SOLTERA LUCHA DÍA A DÍA  PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO Y A SU PEQUEÑO HIJO. CON MUCHO ESFUERZO ESTA TERMINANDO SUS ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIOS EN EL SABATINO, PARA PODER TRABAJAR  DE LUNES A VIERNES Y  PROPORCIONARLE  A SU HIJO LO QUE NECESITA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE COSMÉTICOS POR CATÁLOGOS, COMO: PERFUMES, RUBOR, SOMBRAS DE OJOS, DELINEADORES, LÁPIZ DE OJOS, ANTI OJERAS, ILUMINADORES, LÁPIZ LABIAL, BRILLOS, BODY, ANTI-ARRUGAS, CREMA HIDRATANTES ETC. LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA JOVEN MADRES ES DE UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS A CLIENTES FIJOS  Y EVENTUALES PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. SUS METAS Y SUEÑOS ES PODER TERMINAR SU CARRERA Y TENER MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA CON SU PEQUEÑO HIJO.  EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRAR COSMÉTICOS COMO: PERFUMES, RUBOR, SOMBRAS DE OJOS, DELINEADORES, LÁPIZ DE OJOS, ANTI OJERAS, ILUMINADORES, LÁPIZ LABIAL, BRILLOS, BODY, ANTI-ARRUGAS, CREMA HIDRATANTES ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. KATHERINE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Katherine is 21 years old; she is a single mother with a 3-year-old child, and is from León. This young woman is characterized as very hard-working with the desire to get ahead and fight for her son to offer them economic and emotional stability that he deserves. As a single mother, she struggles day to day to get her business and her young son ahead. With a lot of effort, she is finishing her university studies in the weekend program, to be able to work Monday through Friday and provide her son with what he needs. 

Thanks to her desires to get ahead, she works selling cosmetics by catalog such as perfumes, blush, eye shadow, eyeliner, eye pencils, eye creams, highlighting concealer, lip pencils, lip gloss, anti-wrinkle creams, moisturizers, etc. This young mother's work routine is some ten hours each day offering her products to regular and occasional customers so that in the not-too-distant future she can get more income. Her goal and dream is to be able to finish her degree and have better living conditions with her young son. The objective for the loan is to invest in her working capital and purchase cosmetics such as perfumes, blush, eye shadow, eyeliner, eye pencils, eye creams, highlighting concealer, lip pencils, lip gloss, anti-wrinkle creams, moisturizers, etc. so that in the not-too-distant future she will be able to get more income. 

Katherine is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people with limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, blush, eye shadow, eyeliner, eye pencils, eye creams, highlighting concealer, lip pencils, lip gloss, anti-wrinkle creams, moisturizers, etc.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang is 48 years old and a married rice farmer with five children. She lives in the Takeo province of Cambodia.

So far she has been cultivating rice for over 30 years. As for her children, two of them are factory workers and three attend school. Her husband (with the borrower in the photo) is a 48-year-old construction foreman. All of them can make around 23.50 USD a day.

Because she is short of finances, Nang would like to secure a loan to buy more lumber and roof tiles to build a house. With the loan she will be able to have a proper house for her family’s living. As for more plans, she is going to pave around her house. Moreover, she also wants to help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy more lumber and roof tiles to build a house

loans.name: Dúo Arado Group

texts.es:
Dúo Arado
Este dúo está integrado por Glenda Aracely originaria de una aldea de Sumpango ella es soltera, Glenda se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y elaborar delantales típicos,y necesita de capital para invertir en esta temporada necesita elaborar mas delantales típicos, es el primer crédito que solicita a kiva ya que es una oportunidad que se presenta para poder invertir en su negocio y promete pagar puntualmente.
texts.en: This pair includes Glenda Aracely, who is from the village of Sumpango and is single. Glenda is dedicated to raising pigs and making traditional aprons. She needs capital to invest at this time, which she needs to make more traditional aprons. This is the first loan that she has requested from Kiva. She decided to request the loan because it is an opportunity to invest in her business, and she promises to repay the loan punctually.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making traditional aprons.

loans.name: Andrea Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Andrea, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22,  20, 19  y 9 años, los tres menores estudian dos en universidad y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Andrea es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que trabaja para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de damas,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres veces por semana a ofrecer sus productos, los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, lleva más de 5 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo que le sirve para los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa interior ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean  profesionales.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro loan group meets once every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known nationally and internationally; it is the place where the famous Panama hats are made.

Andrea lives here; she is 39 years old, is married and has four children ages 22, 20, 19 and 9 years from that relationship. The three youngest are studying, two in university and the youngest in school. Her husband is a stonemason.

Andrea is a great homemaker and a good wife who works to help her husband with the household expenses. She makes a living by selling women's underwear. She sells door-to-door, going out two or three times a week to offer her products, which she leaves on credit or charges by the week. She has had this business for more than five years and earning her own money has served to cover the expenses for her children's studies. 

This loan is to buy underwear, as she has a lot of requests. She has been in the loan group for four years and likes it because the loans are helpful. Her dreams are for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Estela Liduvina

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Estela, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos, tres mayores y el menor de 6 años de edad. Su esposo es maestro soldador.
Doña Estela es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y con sus ganancias ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella  se dedica al comercio, desde hace 5 años vende ropa de todos tipo pero hace dos meses atrás surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende productos  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes entre otras cosas, a pesar de que recién empezó su negocio este le está dejando muy buenos ingresos, aunque sus ventas de ropa las continua ya que es así como siempre se gano la vida, ahora con la ayuda de este crédito espera surtir mas su tienda para así ir mejorando su situación económica.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda va a comprar arroz, azúcar y otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son mejora su negocio.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro loan group meets twice a month in the Montecristi canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts which are recognized nationally and internationally. The area is also home to the famous straw hats.

45-year old Sra. Estela lives here. She is married and has four children, three now grown up and a 6-year old. Her husband is a master welder. She is a woman who enjoys taking advantage of every opportunity to get ahead. The money she earns is used to help her husband with household expenses. She has run a business selling all kinds of clothing for five years.

Two months ago Estela started a small grocery store in her house selling products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent etc. Although it hasn’t been open long, the store is already generating a very good income. She is still continuing with the clothing store as it is how she has always earned money. With help from this loan Estela hopes to better stock her store so that she can continue to improve her financial situation.

She plans to buy rice, sugar, and other basics for the store with the loan money. She has been four years with this loan group and enjoys it because the loans provide help for her business. Her dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, and other basics

loans.name: Edith Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Edith, tiene  40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos, tres  mayores de edad y uno de 9 años el cual estudia en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Edith es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor, él se dedica al comercio, vende gafas, pulseras, collares y muchas otras artesanías, él se desplaza a ciertas playas del país como san Jacinto, San Clemente, Bahía, Salinas entre otras lugares que visita por varios días para vender sus productos, luego regresa a surtirse de mas mercadería, descasa unos días y vuelve  a sus recorridos, de esta forma el se gana el sustento de su familia ya son más de 20 años trabajando de esta forma. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar gafas, collares, pulseras y otras artesanías. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son tener un carro para que su marido realice sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro communal bank group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are known at a national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw hats. 

Edith, age 40, lives in this place. She is married and from this relationship has 4 children, 3 who are adults, and one who is 9 years old and goes to school. All of the children still live with her. Her husband is a businessman.

Edith is a very good wife who takes out loans so that her husband can use them in his work. He works in trade, selling glasses, bracelets, necklaces, and many other crafts. He goes to certain beaches in the country, such as San Jacinto, San Clemente, Bahía, and Salinas, among other places where he stays for several days to sell his products. Later, he returns to stock up on more merchandise, rest a few days, and return to his travels. In this way, he earns his family's sustenance, and has worked like this for more than 20 years.

This loan will be used to purchase glasses, necklaces, bracelets and other crafts. She has been a member of this group since the beginning and she likes it because in this way she can help her husband. Her dream is to have a car for his husband to make his trips.

loans.use: to purchase glasses, necklaces, bracelets and other crafts.

loans.name: Neyda Monserate

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Neyda, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  15, 9 y 3 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Neyda es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ganarse lo suyo y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una heladería en su casa donde vende helados de una marca nacional muy reconocida,  gaseosas, aguas, jugos energizantes y varias bebidas mas, los días que más vende son los fines de semana que es cuando se reúnen  sus clientes a jugar por unas canchas que están frente a su casa, ya son más de 11 años que lleva con sus negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar helados, gaseosas, aguas, entre otros productos que vende. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede surtir su negocio. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro communal bank group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are known at a national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw hats. 

Neyda, 36 years old, lives in this place. She is married and from this relationship they have three children, ages 15, 9 and 3; the two older ones go to secondary and primary school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Neyda is a woman who likes to work to earn her own money and, with her income, help her husband with the expenses generated by the household. She has an ice cream shop in her house where she sells ice cream from a very well-known national brand, soft drinks, bottled water, energy drinks, and other drinks. The days she sells the most are the weekends because that is when her customers gather to play on some courts that are in front of her house. She has had this business for over 11 years, which allows her to get ahead. 

This loan is to purchase ice cream, soft drinks, and bottled water, among other products that she sells. She has been in this group since the beginning and she likes it because with the loans she can stock her business. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, soft drinks, bottled water, etc.

loans.name: Hennessy

texts.en:
Hennessy is 28 years old, married and has two children, ages 1 and 6. She is from Carles, Iloilo. Her husband is a fisherman. Fishing has been their source of income for four years now. Hennessy is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing weights, fishing nets, rope and floaters. Hennessy would be happy to have additional capital so they can continue fishing without delay. Any profit will be used to buy healthy meals for her family and pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, she hopes to be successful sending her children to school for a better future.

loans.use: to buy fishing weights, fishing nets, rope and floaters

loans.name: Alexis Yovanny

texts.es:
El señor   Alexis de  45  años  de edad vive con su esposa, tiene  02 hijos que dependen de él,  vive en casa propia y se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio del transporte.
 Don Alexis es un hombre trabajador con deseos de salir adelante, necesita el préstamo para ajustar a comprar ocho llantas para sus dos taxis con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y gracias a esta inversión espera mejorar sus vehículos y brindarle mejorar atención a sus clientes.
Don Alexis uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
  
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Alexis is 45 years old, lives with his wife, has 2 children who depend on him, lives in his own house, and has worked for the past 5 years in a transportation business. 

Alexis is a hard-working man with the desire to get ahead. He needs the loan to have enough to purchase eight tires for his two taxis. With the support of this loan, he plans to improve his quality of life and that of his family, and thanks to this investment, he hopes to improve his vehicles and offer better customer service. 

One of Alexis's dreams is that his children finish their schooling. 
  
San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2014.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his transportation business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija  en su casa propia se dedica desde hace 12  años al negocio de venta de Ropa, Hamacas y también vende plásticos como pailas, tasas, vasos, pazcones, soperas y otros más.
Doña Ana María vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Ana María están solicitando el préstamo para surtir de productos sus negocios quiere comprar blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, hamacas, etc. Porque para esta temporada navideña se vende mucho este tipo de productos y espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para seguir apoyando a su familia. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Diciembre del 2014
texts.en:
Ana María is 34 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in their own house, and has worked for the past 12 years in a business selling clothing and hammocks. She also sells plastics such as large dishes, cups, glasses, sieves, soup tureens and others.  

Ana María lives in a town in the south of Honduras, she is an enterprising woman with desires to get ahead and fight day by day to improve her quality of life. 

Ana María is asking for the loan to stock her businesses with an assortment of products. She wants to purchase blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, hammocks, etc. because for the Christmas season, she sells many of these products and she hopes that this investment will allow her to get the necessary income to continue supporting her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  December 2014

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, hammocks, etc. for her businesses.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat is 28 years old and living in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has one child who attends school. 

To support the family, Sat works very hard on his rice farmland.  He grows and sells rice to the local dealers and customers in the market. On average, he is able to make $2.00 a day.

To supplement his earning, Sat has come up with a new business idea.  He wants to raise and sell cows. However, he has insufficient capital. 

Therefore, Sat is applying for a KIVA loan to buy cows. He hopes that this new trade will help improve his live standard. 

Sat is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Lucia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 36 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase cases of soft drinks, dozens of eggs, canned goods, etc.

Joyce has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks, dozens of eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Judith is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of fruits and vegetable to sell for her business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetable to sell

loans.name: Meng's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Bonteay Meas district of Kampot province, Meng is 57 years old and married. She has four children.

The main source of her family income is from farming rice and raising pigs. Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to earn additional income for his family. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Meng has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. She fully paid back the past loan. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine for using in her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Scheyla Maria

texts.es: Sheyla María: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, de la etnia miskita; tiene 46 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad. Desde hace 4 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, generando sus ingresos propios con lo cual aporta económicamente en el hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más mercadería para ofertar en su pulpería y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y de esa manera poder también mejorar su vivienda que necesita reparación. Su sueño es llegar a ser una negociante exitosa, con un negocio grande, próspero y tener una casa bonita
texts.en: Sheyla María is from Puerto Cabezas. She is of the Miskito ethnicity. She is 46 years old and has three grown children. Four years ago, she opened her little store. With it she generates her own income with which she supports her home financially. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to offer in her store so she can increase her income and improve her home which needs to be repaired. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman with a big, prosperous business, and to have a nice house.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emeleta

texts.en: Emeleta is 51 years old and a mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a small business selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. Emeleta has requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, aluminum foil, to help her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years and she hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, and aluminum foil for her BBQ food business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Jessica Yalu

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Su familia es unida, vive en casa familiar con sus padres, cónyuge y 02 hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amable que se dedican a la agricultura, ganaderia y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros para aumentar el stock de su negocio. Con esto Jessica espera ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes, satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias, lo que le generará un mayor nivel de ingresos y logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica is 34 years old and has a domestic partner. Her family is united and lives in a familial house with her parents, her spouse, and two children in the district of Cayaltí, the province of Chiclayo, and the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. She lives in a community inhabited by friendly people who make their livings in agriculture, raising livestock, and shops.

Jessica's business is selling groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and others. She has more than three years of experience in her shop and has  very good personal and work references in her area. 

This loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of products such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and others, in order to increase her store's stock. With this, Jessica hopes to offer a larger quantity of products to her customers, satisfying their needs and preferences, which will generate more profits and help her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of products such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and others to expand her store's stock.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 21 y 14  años, el menor estudia en colegio, ella vive sola con sus hijos. 
Do0ña Ana es una mujer muy luchadora que le toco trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es padre y madre  a la vez y hace lo que sea para que a ellos no les falte lo necesario para vivir, ella tiene  un negocio en su casa, allí se dedica a la venta de pollos por libras, aguas, colas, entre otras cosas, todos los días de desplaza a una granja que hay por la ciudad donde compra los pollos a muy buen precio, luego los faena y vende ya sea enteros o por libras a vecinos del lugar, lleva más de 16 años con esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio va a comprar pollos, aguas, jugos y sodas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que  le dan con los créditos.  Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro communal bank group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are known at a national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw hats. 

Ana, 40 years old, lives in this place. She is the single mother of two children, ages 21 and 14. The younger one is a secondary school student. She lives alone with her children. 

Ana is a very determined woman who has to work very hard to get her children ahead, since she is both the father and the mother and she does whatever she can so they don't lack what is necessary to live. She has a business in her house, there she sells chickens by the weight, bottled water, soft drinks, among other things. Every day she goes to a farm in the city where she buys the chickens at a very good price, later she slaughters them and sells them either whole or by weight to the neighbors. She has does this work for over 16 years, with which she gets her children ahead. 

This loan will be used to stock her business more; she will purchase chickens, bottled water, juices and soft drinks. She has been a member of the group since the beginning and she likes it for the help that the loans give her. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: Comprar pollos, aguas, jugos y sodas.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. She is dedicated to the business of a local store. Age 41 years; she is married and has three children. It is clear that Maria del Carmen works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Maria del Carmen is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (potato and vegetable). Age 25 years; he is unmarried. It is clear that Adrian works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that the solar energy system will improve his living conditions.
Adrian is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and save in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (corn and beans). Age 39 years; he is widowed and has six children. It is clear that Feliciano works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Feliciano is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señorita Rosa, tiene 30 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Rosa es una joven muy trabajadora que le gusta  ayudarles  a sus padres que son de escasos recursos económicos, ella en sociedad con su papá tienen un negocio, el es artesano y fabrica barriles de madera, sillas, hamacas y otras artesanías los mismos que luego él se encarga de vender en ciudades como Manta, Portoviejo y Guayaquil,  ella le ayuda vendiendo en su casa ya que allí también llegan muchos clientes, el lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta actividad y ella dos años que es parte del negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar madera pinturas y otros materiales que el necesita para elaborar sus obras, lleva 3 años en el Grupo De  Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro communal bank group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are famous at a national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw hats. 

Rosa, 30 years old, lives in this place. She is single and lives in her parents' house.

Rosa is a very hard-working young woman who likes to help her parents since they have limited economic resources. She has a business with her father. He is an artisan and makes wooden barrels, chairs, hammocks, and other crafts which he then takes to sell in cities such as Manta, Portoviejo and Guayaquil. She helps him by selling from their house since many customers come there as well. He has worked for over 20 years in this and she has been part of the business for two years.

This loan is to purchase wood, paint, and other materials that he needs to make his artworks. She has been in the group for three years and likes it for the help that she gets with the loans. Her dream is to have a nice retail space.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint and other materials.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.



Rosalia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business.



Rosalia has been in this business for 15 years now.



Rosalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a planing machine to facilitate his work in his shop.

loans.name: Elvira Margarita

texts.es:
Elvia tiene 55 años de edad tiene dos hijos de 28 y 26 años con los que vive en Echeandia Povincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Mujeres Emprendedoras, Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa infantil solicita el credito para invertir en mercaderia ya que se viene las festividades navideñas y el negocio es bueno por esas fechas, realiza las compras en la ciudad de Guayaqil cada 15 dias. 
Su sueño es crecer con su negocio y en su tiempo libre le gusta ir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Elvira, 55, has two children who are 28 and 26 years old and lives with them in Echeandia, in the province of Bolivar. She is a member of the communal bank, "Ventanilla Rural Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Female Entrepreneurs of Window to the Countryside). She sells children's clothing and is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise because the Christmas season is here and her business does very well at this time. She buys her clothing in the city of Guayaqil every 15 days.

Her dream is to grow her business and in her spare time, she enjoys going to church.

loans.use: invest in her clothing business.

loans.name: Orlyn

texts.en:
Orlyn is 33 years old, and married with a four-year-old son. Ten years ago, she started investing in fishing with her husband, who is a fisherman. Orlyn would like to make a few changes to be more productive in their fishing. She is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, ropes and fishing boats. A sturdy net will allow them to catch in bulk. 

Orlyn works hard for her son. Part of her income will be saved for his education, to pay for a healthy diet, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, ropes and fishing boats

loans.name: Central Dolores Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento Central Dolores está compuesta por ocho integrantes de las cuales son 7 mujeres y 1 varon se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios.

La presidenta del banco es la señora Carmen es una mujer de 41 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos de 15, 10, 13, 8 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de moldes de horno que están hecha de láminas de plancha, Ella es buena madre, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la Ceja de El Alto De clima frio, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, cabello negro habla español por el comercio (sentada en medio). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja realizando los moldes de lámina de plancha y su esposa es la que vende los moldes ya fabricados; sus hijos estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas. Su negocio es la venta de estos moldes de plancha que  son usados  para la elaboración de masitas tortas y galletas Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que lleva con esta actividad. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales, como también aumentar sus ventas y fabricación de sus productos. “aprendí esta actividad junto a mi esposo y con esta actividad mantenemos a nuestra familia…” comenta. Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de láminas de plancha para fabricación de moldes para hornos.
texts.en:
There are eight members in the Central Dolores enterprise bank, seven of whom are women and one man. They have a variety of businesses such as vehicle upholstery, selling milkshakes, selling cellphone covers, selling juice, selling perfume, selling soft drinks, and selling clothing. They are seeking a loan to expand their businesses.

Sra. Carmen is the president of the bank. She is 41 years old, married, and has five children aged 15, 10, 13, 8 and 6. Her business is selling cast ovens molded from metal sheets. She is a good mother, generous, understanding, responsible, and hardworking.

Carmen sells the ovens from a stall in La Ceja de El Alto where the climate is cold and the average daily temperature varies between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade. She is dark skinned and has black hair. She speaks Spanish for business purposes; (she is seated in the middle).

She shares her life with her husband who makes the ovens; she does the selling once they are made. Their children attend school. They live in a rented house which has drinking water, electricity, a sewage system, and gas. The ovens they sell are used to make pastries and cookies.

This is the first time that Carmen has taken out a loan with this institution in the 20 years she has been in business. Her dream is to see her children get good jobs. She also wants to increase sales and production. She notes that she learned the job along with her husband, and it is how they support their family. It is for these reasons that Carmen is seeking a loan to buy metal sheets to make ovens.

loans.use: buy metal sheets to make ovens

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 52-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her son wants to establish a small general store at the corner of his house. He has a spare shop for many years and wants to establish this shop into a general store. However, due to lack of availability of funds he is unable to buy initial stocks of inventories.

Shamim has requested a loan for her son’s newly established general store. Now, he can easily buy stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva field partner's BRAC

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits for her son's newly established general store.

loans.name: M.chantal

texts.en: M. Chantal is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 9 years, two of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been in a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, soap, handkerchiefs and lotion to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more salt, soap, handkerchiefs and lotion to sell.

loans.name: Rica Salve

texts.en:
Rica Salve is 27 years old, married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Rica Salve runs a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like flour, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Rica Salve would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food  production business like flour, sugar, etc

loans.name: Filadelfo

texts.es:
Filadelfo es un campesino de 53 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 
Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee un cultivo de pasto, cultivo que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de La Dorada, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 
Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando su cultivo de pasto y tendrá una mejor cosecha. 

Filadelfo, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Filadelfo, age 53, is a hardworking and humble farmer. When he was a child, he learned everything about working on a farm thanks to the lessons from his parents. As a result, he has been able to make progress and now he has land on which he produces fodder. He cultivates his land every day and his harvested crops are sold at the plaza market in the town of La Dorada. In addition, he works as a day laborer at different farms in the region. Whatever he earns is added to the income that he sets aside for the welfare of his parents, who are striving to get ahead.

With the help of the loan he is requesting from Interactuar, Filadelfo will buy farming supplies in bulk such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and other items. This will help him continue maintaining his crop of fodder so that he can achieve a better harvest.

With his enterprising spirit, strength, and tenacity, Filadelfo wants to keep striving so that he can fulfill his dream of having his own farm. This will allow him to cultivate a wider variety of products and improve the profitability of his business. This would guarantee financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, bread and more for her store.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent with a child, Julie Ann works hard to support her family. She runs a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business. Julie Ann has successfully repaid her previous loan and has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans through NWTF.

Julie Ann is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as sugar, flour, and other items for her food vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, and other items

loans.name: Tania Amada

texts.es: Tania Amada: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de un pequeño hijo de dos meses, trabaja como secretaria. Está solicitando por primera vez un préstamo para reparar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: Tania Amada is a determined woman, from Puerto Cabezas, a single mother with a small son, 2 months old, and who works as a secretary. She asks for a loan for the first time to repair the roof on her house since it is in bad condition. With the loan, she will be able to purchase planed wood, nails and pay labor costs. Her dream is to provide her family with a more secure house in better condition.

loans.use: to repair the roof on her house, which is in bad condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. She is dedicated to Agriculture (coffee). Age 34 years; she is married and has one child. It is clear that Sofia works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her child will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Sofia is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Coffee, corn and beans). Age 53 years; he is married and has two children. It is clear that Faustino works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Faustino is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is dedicated to Agriculture (coffee). Age 43 years; she is divorced and has three children. It is clear that Domitila works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Domitila is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Coffee, corn and beans). Age 58 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Marcial works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Marcial is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: María Elvira es una mujer emprendedora de 48 años, casada y madre de dos hijos, es propietaria de una pulpería además comercializa ropa de segunda en su domicilio desde hace dos años, es segundo ciclo que solicita en ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio y lo invertirá en la compra de paca de ropa de camisetas, pantalones, short, granos básicos, caramelos y chiverías.
texts.en:
María Elvira is an enterprising woman. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of two children. María Elvira is the owner of a shop in her home where she has been selling secondhand clothing for two years.

This is the second loan she has requested from ADIM for her business. She will invest in the purchase of a bundle of clothes that includes T-shirts, trousers, and shorts. She will also buy basic grains, caramels, and yogurts.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of clothes that includes T-shirts, trousers, and shorts, and to buy basic grains, caramels, and yogurts.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passenger.  Carmelita is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Johana Amanda Yamileth

texts.es:
Johana de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años de edad que ya asiste al kínder, estudió hasta 3er grado de educación básica, con ella además de su hijo viven dos hermanas y su madre, pero solo su hijo depende de ella. Es comerciante y desde hace 6 años administra una tienda, aprendió de su hermana que también se dedica a este tipo de negocio, la tienda la tiene en su casa y le apoya su madre. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, productos de higiene personal y demás para su tienda y con ello espera mantener estables las ventas para seguir manteniendo a su hijo que espera algún día se gradúe como profesional.
texts.en:
Johana is 26 years old. She is the single mother of a 5 year old son who is already in kindergarten. She went to school up to the 3rd grade of basic education. Two sisters and her mother also live with her and her son, but only her son depends on her. She has been a merchant for 6 years. She runs a small store. She learned from her sister, who also works in this type of business. She has the store in her house and her mother helps her.  

She is asking for the loan to buy basic grains, sugar, personal hygiene products and more for her store. With this, she hopes to keep the sales stable to continue supporting her son. She hopes that one day, he will graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, personal hygiene products and more.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Rosie has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, noodles, sugar, etc.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jennyfer Elizabeth

texts.es: Jennyfer Elizabeth: Es una mujer  emprendedora, originaria de Bilwi, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos: Una mayor de edad de 22 años y el menor de 14 años que estudia su secundaria. Además de trabajar como asistente del área de ultrasonido en el único hospital que se cuenta en esta pequeña ciudad, vende repostería y gaseosas para tener otra fuente de ingresos que le permitan sufragar los gastos de estudios de sus hijos. El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar insumos  para su negocio de repostería. Su sueño es llegar a tener un local cómodo, con vitrinas de vidrio donde exponga la repostería y que tenga buenas condiciones para atender mejor a los clientes.
texts.en:
Jennyfer Elizabeth is a woman entrepreneur who is originally from Bilwi. She is a 40 years old single mother of 2 kids, the older one is 22 years old and the younger one is 14 and is studying in high school. Besides working as an assistant in the ultrasound area of the only hospital in this small town, she also sells pastries and soft drinks.  She does so in order to obtain income to help her cover the costs of her children’s education.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy supplies for her pastry business.  Her dream is to have a cozy shop with glass display cases where she can put her pastries on display and which also has good conditions to better serve her clients.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her pastry business

loans.name: Chandoeurn's Group

texts.en: ChanDoeurn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. ChanDoeurn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Hun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hun makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families while saving money on medical expenses and saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vanny makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help each of the team members to safeguard the health of their families while saving money on medical expenses and saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vansoun's Group

texts.en:
Vansoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vansoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and sells groceries at home to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families while saving money on medical expenses and saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Janneth Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa es una joven muy alegre y luchadora, ella y su hermana crecieron con su madre ya que su padre no se hizo cargo de ellas, Vanessa trabaja  de empleada domestica y cuidando   un mayorcito, también se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores y en esta ocasión va a invertir el crédito en la compra de pollos para ayudarse en sus gastos diarios, Vanessa aspira de este negocio readecuarlo para que quede apropiado para criar más cantidad de pollos y de esta manera seguir trabajando y apoyar a su madre en el hogar.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a very happy and determined young woman. She and her sister grew up at their mother's side, since their father did not take care of them.

She works in domestic services and as a babysitter for an older child.

She also raises small animals, and with this loan she will invest in the purchase of chickens. This will help her cover her daily expenses.

Vanessa's goal is to accomodate this business so that she can raise a greater number of chickens. She can then continue working this way and helping her mother at home.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Vansy's Group

texts.en: Vansy’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vansy makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Morn's Group

texts.en: Morn’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Morn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
OFELIA DE 49 AÑOS DE EDAD MADRE SOLTERA CON UN HIJO MAYOR DE EDAD, EL CUAL ES INDEPENDIENTE Y TRABAJA,  ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, Y SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, DESDE MUY JOVEN SE DEDICO A TRABAJAR, PARA GANARSE EL PAN DE CADA DÍA YA QUE SU FAMILIA ERAN DE ESCASOS RECURSOS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA PARA MANTENER SU NEGOCIO Y SU VIDA INDEPENDIENTE,  ELLA COMENZÓ VENDIENDO VERDURAS, COMO LE GUSTABA EL NEGOCIO DECIDIÓ COMENZAR A VENDER MERCADERÍA COMO ROPA ZAPATOS PERFUMES, Y VIO QUE LE DIO RESULTADO EN LA ACTUALIDAD HA MANTENIDO SU NEGOCIO GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL.
GRACIAS A SUS PERSEVERANCIA Y SU AMOR POR EL TRABAJO TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD LA VENTA DE ROPA PERFUMES ZAPATOS DESDE HACE VEINTITRÉS AÑOS QUE SE DESEMPEÑA EN EL NEGOCIO  Y LO TIENE UBICADO EN UN TRAMO DE UNOS DE LOS MERCADO DE SU LOCALIDAD. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y APROVECHAR LA TEMPORADA DE LA ENTRADA DE CLASES DE NIÑOS Y JÓVENES A LOS COLEGIOS.  POR LO TANTO NECESITA MERCADERÍA COMO: CAMISAS, PANTALONES, FALDAS, BLUSAS, MOCHILAS, CALCETINES, CAMISOLAS, FAJAS, ZAPATOS NEGRO DE COLEGIO ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. OFELIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a 49-year-old single mother of one adult son who is independent and works. She is originally from Managua and is hardworking, responsible and driven to improve her personal situation. She started working from a very young age to earn her daily bread as her family had a low income. She currently works hard to maintain her business and her independent life. 

She started off selling vegetables and as she liked the business she decided to start selling products such as clothing, shoes, and perfumes and had good results. She runs this business to the present day due to her motivation to better herself.

As a result of her perseverance and her love for her work her business activities include selling clothing, perfumes and shoes. She has been putting her efforts into the business for twenty three years and it is located in one of the markets in her local area. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and take advantage of the season when children and young people are going back to school. Therefore, she needs stock such as shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, backpacks, socks, camisoles, belts, black school shoes, etc so that in the not too distant future she can improve her income. Ofelia acknowledges the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua. This enables these individuals to have work that is dignified.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise such as shorts, pants, skirts, blouses, backpacks, socks, camisoles, belts, black school shoes, etc

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pov makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phenh's Group

texts.en: Phenh’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phenh makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and seller buy selling grocery at home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rim's Group

texts.en: Rim’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 59 años de edad, es casada, sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Victoria se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ella solicita préstamo es para invertir en compra de una cantidad mayor de animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Victoria piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old, married, without any children in her care. She lives with her family in a rural zone in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. In this district, the population works in agriculture, raising animals, and in trade. 

Victoria works raising and selling animals, with more than 8 years of experience in the business. The business is located in her home. She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of animals. This investment will serve her to have more variety and productivity in animals, with a great impact on her business. Victoria plans to increase her stock of animals to be able to meet the diverse tastes and needs of the customers in the zone. This will allow her, in the short term, to improve her sales, increase her earnings, with the end of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in a larger quantity of animals.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 41 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Imelda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her business.

Imelda has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Imelda is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (African palm). Age 58 years; he is married and has two children. It is clear that Lorenzo works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Lorenzo is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is  years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 4 years, not yet in school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to use to grow maize and sell the maize.  The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to use to grow maize and sell the maize.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Coffee). Age 56 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Daniel works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Daniel is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

texts.en:
Francisco lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (coffee). Age 45 years; he is married and has four children. It is clear that Francisco works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. Francisco is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 52 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 13 and 32 years; five of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to use to grow maise and then sell the maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to use to grow maise and then sell the maize.

texts.en:
Felipe lives in a community in the Department of Santa Barbara Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Coffee). Age 47 years; he is married and has five children. It is clear that Felipe works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Felipe is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Merlin Mauricio

texts.en:
Merlin Mauricio lives in a community in the Department of Santa Barbara Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Coffee). Age 24 years; he is married and has two children. It is clear that Merlin Mauricio works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Merlin Mauricio is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Malia Kalameli

texts.en: Malia is a single mother with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. Malia has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, está luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante, para poder ser un buen profesional.
El quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y poder ayudar a su familia. Aspira tener un negocio propio el día de mañana.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Blas is from the city of Villarrica. He is studying for a degree in Systems Analysis. Blas is striving to grow and move forward so that he can become a successful professional. He wants to improve his quality of life and be able to help his family. Someday he would like to have his own business.

Blas is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his degree fees. This would allow him to continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Solidarios Rosas De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Solidarios Rosas de Villa Nueva
Serapia es madre soltera, tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales todos tiene su propia familia, ella inicio su negocio hace 21 años cuando nació su ultima hija y se vio en la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo económicamente, inicio vendiendo verduras pollo y pescado de forma ambulante durante 10 años durante ese tiempo introdujo venta de ropa de cama zapatos que trae de Tapachula, ella solicita el crédito para poder invertir en productos(zapatos, ropa,y productos de usos domesticos)ya que es una época de mucha demanda de su mercadería,  le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que se desemvuelve muy bien con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Solidarios Rosas de Villa Nueva Group 
Serapia is a single mother and has 6 children, all of whom have their own families. She started her business 21 years ago when she gave birth to her last daughter and there was a need to support her husband financially.  She began as a mobile vender selling vegetables, chicken and fish for 10 years, and during that time she started selling bed linen and shoes that she brought from Tapachula. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase goods (shoes, clothing and household products) as it is a time when there is high demand for her products. She really likes her work as she gets along well with her clients.

loans.use: to purchase household products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's enrollment fees, tuition, a computer, and rent.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
