As a married mother of two children, Maria Fe works hard to support her family. She has a buying-and-selling-vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Maria Fe is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Maria Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 58 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Fortunata has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

Fortunata has been in this business for three years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 44 years old. He is married with five children aged between 2 and 19 years; four of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for eight years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to use to grow maize and then sell the maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to use to grow maize and then sell the maize.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 24 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Arlene works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes De Los Angeles

texts.es: Desde muy niña Mercedes comenzó a trabajar con su mama, se casó muy joven y tuvo a sus hijas a muy temprana edad eso no le impidió salir adelante y viajo a costa rica para brindarle mejores condiciones a sus hijas pero luego decidió regresar a Nicaragua y poner su propio negocio de venta de comida como vigoron y también refrescos, para seguir manteniendo el negocio y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, Mercedes solicita un crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite al por mayor. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa ya que por el momento se encuentra viviendo con su suegra.
texts.en: When she was a little girl, Mercedes began cooking with her mother. She married very young and had her daughters when she was very young, but this didn't keep her from moving ahead. She moved to Costa Rica in order to provide her daughters with better conditions, but she later decided to return to Nicaragua and set up her own business selling food, such as vigorón, as well as soft drinks. To keep up her business and meet the demand of her customers, Mercedes is requesting a loan to buy wholesale rice, sugar, and oil. Her future plans include buying a plot of land and building her own house as she is presently living with her mother-in-law.

loans.use: To buy wholesale rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling sea shells. Susan is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of personal items to sell to her customers.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal items to sell.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa la socia tiene 35 años de edad es separada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesania,la socia hace tejidos como chompas ,chalinas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de diferentes colores de lana.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tejidos de chompas, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de restaurante, venta de mates, venta de verduras.

La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
These are the members of the Las Palmeras Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member Señora Teresa is 35 years old.  She is separated and she has three children. 

She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling artisanal products.  She knits sweaters, scarves, and other items that her customers request. She has had her business for some time, and it is going well for her, thanks to the hard work that she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way, she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of wool in different colors.

The other members devote themselves to businesses such as selling artisanal products, knitting sweaters, a taxi service, a restaurant, selling herbal teas, and selling vegetables. The lady in the attached photo is a member who requested permission to come to the meeting late because she was working.

The member thanks those who are part of this dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wool in different colors.

loans.name: Wilber Adolfo

texts.es:
Wilber es un señor divorciado , con tres hijos a su cargos en edad escolar a los que les brinda su apoyo para su desarrollo. Este señor se desempeña como maestro de educacion primaria desde hace 8 años en una escuela en la comunidad donde habita.
Actualmente este señor se a cerco a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar su primer financiamiento con nuestra institucion el cual lo utilizaria para la compra de materiales de construccion tales como:ladrillos, hierro, cemento, arena, piedrin y pago de mano de obra, ya que su casa de habitacion esta  en mal estado y necesita reparar parades . y de esta manera ir mejorando sus condiciones  y nivel de vida  tanto de sus hijos como la de este señor.
texts.en:
Wilber is a divorced man, responsible for providing for the development of three children who are in school. He has worked as a primary education teacher for 8 years at a school in the community where he lives.

Currently he is seeking his first loan through Ceprodel. He will use the money to purchase construction materials such as bricks, iron, cement, sand, gravel, and also to pay for labor. His house is in bad condition and needs repair. In this way he will improve the standard of living for himself and his children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as bricks, iron, cement, sand, gravel, and also to pay for labor.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a married woman and the mother of three children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Remy has been in this buissness for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. Remy is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, rice, canned goods, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, condiments, etc. With this loan, she will be able to attract more buyers to her store, thus increasing her sales and income. 

In the future, Remy hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, rice, canned goods, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 47 years old and has two children. With one of her children in school, Estrella works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Estrella has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell through her direct-selling Avon products business, like lotion, perfume, and shirts.

Lanie has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from food-vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like lotion, perfume, and shirts.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old with one child in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods and groceries

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leslie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Leslie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like pants, shorts, shirts, etc. to sell for her buy-and-sell ready to wear products business.

Leslie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like pants, shorts, shirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 53 years old and a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelaida has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Adelaida has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 34 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising chickens. Arlene aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lendie

texts.en:
Lendie is 31 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, spices, coffee, etc. to sell.

Lendie has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling gasoline.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, spices, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Analiza has a charcoal-retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 27 years old. He is not married. He has been farming for 11 years, and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer for maize and bananas, which he will sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for maize and bananas

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf is 37 years old.  He is married with three children aged between 3 and 11 years; all of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for four years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for the maize he sells. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market, and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for maize

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 30 years old. She is married with two children, aged 3 and 5 years; both of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to use to grow maize and then sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay her employees and increase her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to use to grow maize and then sell maize.

loans.name: Shemsa Aime

texts.en: Shemsa Aime is 27 years old. she is married with two children aged 1 and 4 years; both of them go to school. She sells maize and has been in business for seven years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more maize and beans to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Wend Ya Ye Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe WEND YA YE.  Elle est mariée et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont  à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration   depuis  04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son  secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 04 bidons d’huile de 20l.
Mme veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne s'acheter une moto et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatimata is the representative of the Wend Ya Ye group. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is eleven, and the youngest four years old. She has worked in food preparation for four years. She buys her merchandise in the local market.
She wants to buy two bags of rice and four 20 litre containers of oil. She wants to put her profits into her savings, and her ambition is to buy a motorbike and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice and four large oilcans.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 44 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 5 and 16 years, all of them go to school. She has been farming for 18 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize and sell the maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow maize and sell the maize.

loans.name: Wendenso De Koanga Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur SANDAOGO est le représentant du groupe WENDENSO DE KOANGA. Marié, il est  père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 30 ans et le moins âgé a 27ans. 01 va à l’école. 
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il veut s’acheter  02 moutons ; 10  poules.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour la scolarisation de ses enfants et agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne être un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Mr. SANDAOGO is the representative of the group WENDENSO DE KOANGA. A married man, he is the father of four children. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 27. One goes to school. Mr. SANDAOGO has been a livestock farmer for ten years. He gets his supplies from the market in his district. He wants to purchase 2 sheep and 10 hens. He wants to save his profits for his children’s schooling and to expand his business. His ambition is to be a major livestock farmer.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep and ten hens

loans.name: Marycris

texts.en:
This is Marycris. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of frozen food products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to purchase more frozen food like ham, hotdogs, processed pork and other products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marycris hopes that her business will continue to flourish for she desires to give her children the best education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen food and other items to sell.

loans.name: Violenda

texts.en:
Violenda sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her child and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 12,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Violenda hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of having their own house and lot someday. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marie Blanche

texts.en: Marie Blanche is 35 years old. She is married with two children aged between four and seven years, and both children go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been in a business for two years.  With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice, cooking oil and maize flour to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil and maize flour to resell.

loans.name: Yolanda Margarita

texts.es: Yolanda  es una señora casada, ella creció en el campo y se dedica  a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno, su esposo trabaja de jornalero en trabajos de agricultura, con el que tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 14 años de edad, que asisten a la escuela y se esfuerzan por sr buenos estudiantes, Yolanda compra toretes en los días de la semana y el sábado y domingo los comercializa en las ferias de las ciudades más cercanas, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar toretes y seguir con su negocio  para que le quede ganancias que le permitan darle bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is married and grew up in the countryside. She breeds and sells cattle. Her husband is an agricultural day worker. They have two children, aged 12 and 14 years, who attend school and work hard to be good students.

Yolanda buys young bulls on week days and sells them on Saturdays and Sundays at the closest city fairs. With the money from the loan, she will buy young bulls and continue with her business so that she can obtain earnings that will allow her to provide for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: buy young bulls.

loans.name: Tasila

texts.en:
Tasila is 25 years old. She owns a Zoona mobile money transfer shop in Kitwe, one of the mining towns in Zambia. She comes from a family of five. Tasila describes her business as the service of sending and receiving money. She is very proud of the fact that she has been able to start her business from scratch. 

Before Tasila started her own business, she studied at one of the local colleges and attained a Certified Accounting Technician certificate. This helped her learn some key accounting skills, which she is now applying in the day-to-day running of her business.

Tasila is taking out a Kiva loan so that she can increase her float. Float is the working capital that she uses to serve her customers. Right now, the float is not enough because her shop is located at a very busy location, where the demand is so high that she cannot satisfy all the customers. 

This loan will enable Tasila to serve more customers and earn more profits. The profits will help her to provide basic needs for herself; she would like to move out of her parent’s house once she starts earning more money. She has dreams of going back to college to get a degree. She thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a Zoona branded booth and insure that she has enough money to fulfill customer transactions.

loans.name: Sandra Janeth

texts.es: Sandra es una señora de nacionalidad colombiana, ella hizo su hogar en el Ecuador con un señor que se dedica a cuidar ganado en una finca, ellos tiene 2 hijos la mayor de 13 años y el niño 11 años mismos que asisten alegremente a su escuelita, Sandra trabaja con su marido en la ganadería y en el ordeño de las vacas lecheras, Comenta Sandra que en el dueño de esta finca les hace tener 2 terneras  en su propiedad, el dinero del crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de toretes para mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando en Ecuador ya que este es un país tranquilo y agradece a esta institución por abrirle las puertas y darle el crédito.
texts.en:
Sandra, a woman of Colombian nationality, made her home in Ecuador with a man who earns a living taking care of livestock on a farm.  They have two children, a 13-year-old girl and an 11-year-old boy, who happily attend school.

Sandra works with her husband in ranching and milking the dairy cows.  Sandra said the owner of the property lets her have two heifers on the property.

Sandra's going to use the money from the loan to buy young bulls to improve her business and keep on working in Ecuador because it's a peaceful country.

She's grateful to the institution for opening the door to her and giving her the loan.

loans.use: to buy young bulls

loans.name: Saumama

texts.en: Saumama is a 24-year-old lady who operates a small business of providing services to people by transportation to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Saumama has requested a loan to buy a seat cover, painting, new windows, and new wheels to help her maintain the good services. Saumama hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and provide for family needs. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a seat cover, painting, new windows, and new wheels

loans.name: Josefina De Los Angeles

texts.es: Josefina de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene  muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Josefina it Is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her family. For several years she has been selling clothing as a street vendor in various neighborhoods. 

She has many customers because of her good prices. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more clothing at wholesale, continue selling, and have better income.

loans.use: To buy more clothing at a wholesale.

loans.name: Muhrullo

texts.ru: Мухрулло выходец из городка Вахдат. Ему 41 год. Он хочет возобновить свой торговый бизнес. Дело в том, что несколько лет назад он занимался бизнесом, но по причине семейных обстоятельствя ему пришлось уехать в Россию. Сегодня он снова в своей родине и больше не собирается покидать его. Мухрулло хочет возобновить свой старый бизнес по торговле продуктов питания. Он на свои сбережение арендовал магазин на рынке и сейчас у него на руках всего немного средств. Мухрулло просит в кредит еще 1000 долларов США, чтобы закупить ассортимент продуктов питания. Благодаря кредиту он снова будет иметь свой бизнес и останется на родине рядом с семьей.
texts.en: Muhrullo is native of the town of Vahdat. He is 41 years old. He wants to reopen his retail business. Several years ago, he ran his own business but because of familial circumstances, he left to go to work in Russia. Today, he is once again in his homeland and is not planning on leaving ever again. Muhrullo wants to reopen his old business of selling food products. With his savings, he rented a shop at the market and now he has just a small amount of money left. Muhrullo is requesting a loan for 1000 USD to buy an assortment of food products. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to have his own business again and be able to remain in his homeland close to his family.

loans.use: to buy food products to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Gulbibi

texts.ru:
Гулбиби является одной и не многочисленного населения городка Турсунзаде. Ей всего 23 года. У нее трое детей и муж. Ее муж находиться за приделами страны на заработках. Гулбиби старается помочь мужу и работает на Родине портнихой.  Для Гулбиби это способ принести в дом доход. Ее мужу, как и многим таджикам в Российской Федерации очень тяжело и Гулбиби как верная и умная жена всегда поддерживает его.  
  Для Гулбиби образовалась проблема, ее швейная машинка вот-вот выйдет из строя.  Ей срочно надо купить новую машинку. Она планирует приобрести машинку марки Ямата. Но на новую машинку у нее нет денег.  Она надеется на получения кредита. Гулбиби обещает выплачивать кредит в срок.
texts.en:
Gulbibi lives in the small town of Tursunzade. She is only 23 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is currently abroad as a migrant worker. GUlbibi tries to help her husband and works as a seamstress in her home town. This is how she contributes to the family budget. Her husband, like many Tajiks, is facing many hardships in the Russian Federation; Gulbibi, as a dedicated and resourceful wife, always supports him.

Gulbibi has a problem now because her sewing machine is about to break down completely. Gulbibi needs to buy a new sewing machine right away. She plans to buy a sewing machine of the Yamata brand. However, she lacks the money for it and hopes to obtain a loan. Gulbibi promises to pay off her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy a Yamata sewing machine.

loans.name: St Kagwa Women Group

texts.en: Florence used the previous loan to buy home products such as utensils for selling. Florence is a 31-year-old married female with five children. She is a member of St Kagwa Women Group, living in Kasese, Uganda. Florence has operated a retail shop of household utensils for six years now. She has a dream of becoming rich and educating her children. However, she is faced with a challenge of limited capital and damages caused while transporting her products. Florence needs a loan to buy glasses, plates, cups, flasks and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy glasses, plates, cups, flasks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is an 18-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. His father is a worker in a supermarket where he earns a low income. Yousef is a university student specializing in Nursing. He would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future to improve his family's living conditions. 

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to do his home work and write reports easily. Yousef appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 45 years old and married with eight children. Five of her children are in school and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Angela has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Angela has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Angela would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josefina is 45 years old and both of her children are in school.

Josefina has a buy and sell of brooms business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Josefina  requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to restart her business activities.

Josefina has been in this business for two years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enhance her husband's pan shop

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 37 years old, a married woman and mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by trade and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason; Razia has applied for a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Razia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair cost for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Los planes y el deseo de superación de Julio no tienen límites. Desde que estaba en la universidad este hombre, que actualmente tiene 36 años de edad, ayudaba a su madre con el puesto de venta de frutas y verduras en su casa. Al graduarse como licenciado en Administración de Empresas, consiguió un trabajo de medio tiempo en la Alcaldía con el cual ayudaba a su mamá a sustentar el hogar, sin dejar de apoyarla con su negocio, hasta que un día su mamá se lo heredó cuando ella se fue a Costa Rica.
Ahora Julio ya tiene cuatro años de ser el dueño de este negocio, con el cual poco a poco ha ido prosperando, agregando una pequeña venta de baho, con sillas y mesas para satisfacción de sus clientes. Si bien es cierto que cuenta con el apoyo de dos de sus hermanas, quiere seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar piña, bananos, lechuga, tomate, zanahoria, entre otros productos que más solicitan sus clientes. Esto le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y subir sus metas. Entre sus planes está abrir otro puesto en su municipio y establecer un restaurante.
texts.en:
For Julio, plans and the desire to overcome don't have limits. Since he was in university, this man, who is currently 36 years old, has helped his mother with her stall, where they sell fruits and vegetables in their house. When he graduated with a degree in business administration, he got a part-time job in city hall, which he used to help his mother to sustain their home, while still helping her with her business, until the day she gave it to him when she went to Costa Rica.

Now, Julio has been the owner of this store for four years, which little by little has been thriving. He started selling baho (a meat and yucca dish), with chairs and tables, to satisfy his customers. 

Although it's certain that he counts on the support of two of his sisters, he wants to continue to invest, which is why he asks for a loan to buy pineapples, bananas, lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, and other products that his clients ask for. This will allow him to expand his business capital and to pursue his goals. Another one of his plans is to open another stall in his town and to establish a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, bananas, lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, and other products.

loans.name: Zipindule Group

texts.en:
Lufina is 32-years-old and she grows different types of farm produce in her home area. She started this business in order to financially support her family by providing them with food and other basic needs. Despite growing different types of farm produce, she mainly relies on Irish potatoes since they are highly demanded in her area. 

She will use the loan to buy more inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. She plans of increasing her business in order to have increased profits and she hopes to improve her families living standards. With the profits from her previous loans, she is now able to support her family without any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 54 years old and married with three children. With one of her children in school, Julie works very hard to provide for them.

Julie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, groceries, etc..

Julie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 


In the future, Julie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods and groceries etc.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is an emerging entrepreneur in the town of Kitwe, Zambia. She is 24 years old and has a three year-old daughter Joyce. Precious is requesting a loan to buy a Zoona branded booth and to insure that she has enough money to fulfill customer transactions. This will help her to provide financial services to people in her community.

The trading booth will be used to serve customers in Precious’ community. Most of her customers are unbanked. Zoona has done market research in Precious’s community and has determined that the location for this trading booth is ideal. She is one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in town and a large number of families are already using her service. However, such a high demand for her service means that people must wait in long queues. Having more money in the business will build on her current business and allow her to serve more members of her community. 

Once she secures a loan, Precious will be able to purchase a trading booth from Zoona, which will deliver the booth to her place of business, as well as provide her with additional cash to serve her customers. 

Precious hopes that she will be able to process her client’s transactions much faster with this additional capital. She is hopeful that one day the profits realized from her business will help her go back to school as she did not go to college.

loans.use: to buy a Zoona branded booth and to insure that she has enough money to fulfill customer transactions.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is a 51-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So, he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Majeedan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, to help her son to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Majeedan is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para bebes desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y así poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old. She lives with her family group in a house that they own. She has earned her living selling baby clothes for several years. Her business is located in the municipal market and has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing at wholesale so that she can continue with her sales in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing at wholesale

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar de 26 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudió hasta 9° de educación básica, dejó el estudio y empezó a trabajar para contribuir a los gastos del hogar, Desde muy joven es agricultor, aprendió el oficio trabajando para otras personas como jornalero pero hoy en día trabaja propio y cultiva pipián. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizante y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde va a establecer su cultivo. Oscar sueña con formar su propio hogar y dar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 26 years old, single and has no children. He has a ninth grade education, as he left school and began to work in order to contribute to the household expenses. 

He has been a farmer from a very young age having learned the occupation working for other people as a day laborer. But now he works on his own and grows squash. Is requesting the loan so that he can buy city fertilizer and to pay the rent on the plot of land where he grows his crop. 

Oscar dreams of creating his own household and giving the best to his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the rent on his plot of land.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old and married with ten children. With four of her children in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Erlinda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. Erlinda is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to stock up on a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina is engaged in a hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She has been raising hogs for three years now.  She is a resident in the town of Ormoc, Leyte. She is a 46-year-old married woman with two grown children.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and pig feed. She can now raise and sells healthy pigs. This will help improve her income. She can now continue her livelihood.

In the future, Maria Gina will try her best to manage her hog raising business so it is more productive and she is hoping that this would improve the status of her present living condition.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul es un hombre de 46 años de edad, casado. Tiene un hijo varón de 17 años, y su negocio es la elaboración de muebles de estar.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, comprometido con su trabajo, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ un área caracterizada por el comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados.
Raul es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposa que le ayuda en el comercio y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela y es aficionado al futbol. La familia vive en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas. Su negocio es la elaboración de muebles de estar, como; sillones, sofás y otros. Los materiales que utiliza son diversos, como; madera, cuero, cuerina, esponja y otros. “empecé como ayudante de tapicería y con el paso de los años me independicé, actualmente trabajo con mi hijo que ya elabora muebles sin ayuda de nadie…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su taller y tener operarios que produzcan mayor cantidad. Él desea realizar una inversión en su taller mediante la compra de herramientas de trabajo, como; amoladoras, sierra, madera y material relacionado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Raul solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo para la realización de muebles de estar.
texts.en:
Raul, 46, is married and has a 17-year-old son. He runs a furniture-making business.
He is enterprising, independent, committed to his work, constant, responsible and hard-working. He realizes his work in the "cruce villa Adela" area; an area characterized by all sectors of commerce and manufacturing, it has a cold and dry climate with temperatures that vary between 5 and 15 degrees Celsius during the day.

Raul has tanned skin, short black hair and his mother tongue is Aymara; he speaks Spanish because of his general culture and the business he runs. He lives his life with his wife, who helps him with his work, and his son, who is a student and a soccer aficionado.

The family lives in an adobe house with a calamine roof; they have potable water, electricity, sewage and gas. He runs a furniture-making business in which he manufactures armchairs, sofas and other. He uses diverse materials, like wood, leather, pleather, sponge and other. "I started as an assistant upholsterer and after some years, I went out on my own. I currently work with my son, who makes furniture without any help from anyone", he says. His dream is to expand his workshop and have operators in order to manufacture more quantities. He hopes to invest in his business by buying the tools he needs, like a grinder, saw, wood and related materials. This is his first loan with the institution in the 10 years that he has owned this business.

For these reasons, Raul is requesting a loan to buy work tools to manufacture furniture.

loans.use: buy tools to make furniture.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a 54-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Consolacion has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Consolacion has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rocio Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia Roció Alejandra sigue dedicándose  a  trabajar en un jardín para niños, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera  que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos para sus alumnos.

La socia está feliz con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Roció Alejandra is still operating a kindergarten.  She is a hard-working and responsible person. She has been in her business for some time, which brings her personal satisfaction and is how she is supporting her family. She is requesting a loan so that she you can buy teaching materials for her students.  
She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy teaching materials for her students.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 28 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

May works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, etc.

She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from fishing and pig fattening.

May aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Yolanda requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Yolanda has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 30 years old. She is married with three children between 6 and 11 years old, all of whom go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, small fish and maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and medical insurance.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, small fish and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Living in the populated city of Lahore, Shamim, age 54, carries out her clothes selling business from her house. She has been in this business quite a few years, contributing to the family income. She is married and blessed with four children. Her business has helped her push through the hard days. She sells non-stitched female clothes, buying them from the local market and then selling them at a reasonable profit. This is how she has grown her business and customers. Due to her polite nature, her customers feel comfortable and happy buying clothes from her. 

To sell more varieties of winter season clothes, she has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. She is pleased and thankful that this timely support will be beneficial and fruitful to her.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of clothes for winter, to enhance her clothes selling business

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en: Aireen is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is engaged in retail sales of various goods and food items to the people in her place. Aireen has been in the business for more than eight years now. She is a very hardworking woman and positive about life. She is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, biscuits and bread, toiletries, condiments and others. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers and customers in her store. In the future, Aireen dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, biscuits and bread, toiletries, condiments and others

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 41 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo, estudió hasta 8° grado de educación básica,  con él vive su esposa hijo y su padre, quien es un anciano y depende totalmente de Julio. Se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace más de 24 años, aprendió de su padre que siempre le inculcó siempre ser responsable y trabajador.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar pliegos de lámina y madera para remodelar el techo de una galera donde procesa la leche y elaboran el queso. Sueña con que su hijo sea mecánico ya que ve la importancia de esta profesión y la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Julio, 41, is married with one son.  He attended primary school until the 8th grade.  He lives with his wife, his son, and his father, who is very old and depends upon him completely.  

He has devoted himself to raising cows for more than 24 years, which he learned from his father, who always taught him to be responsible and hard-working.

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase metal sheeting and wood to rebuild the roof of a shed where he processes the milk and makes the cheese.  

He hopes that his son will become a mechanic, as he sees the importance of this profession and the demand for it.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting and wood to rebuild the roof of a shed.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 29 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lolita has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 36 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. Karen works very hard to provide for them.

Karen's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her business. Karen has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to restart her general store. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Karen is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 45 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Enriquita works very hard to provide for them.

Enriquita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Enriquita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Enriquita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make furniture for his private business.

loans.name: Glenda Estela

texts.es: Glenda en una mujer de 46 años, casada, se dedica a la comercialización de artesanías en la capital desde hace dieciséis años, anteriormente era doméstica, de los ahorros y liquidación compró mercadería, gracias a los créditos otorgados comenzó a crecer en el ámbito de los negocios, esto la motivó a seguir solicitando créditos en ADIM y este último lo invertirá en la compra de hamacas, esquineras, muebles para equipo y televisión, etc.
texts.en:
Glenda is a 46-year-old woman who is married. She has been selling handicrafts in the capital for 16 years. Glenda previous worked as a domestic employee. With her savings and severance pay, she purchased merchandise. Thanks to the loans that she was issued, Glenda was able to grow in the business world. This motivated her to continue seeking loans from ADIM.

Her latest loan will be invested in the purchase of hammocks, corner tables, furniture for electronics equipment and televisions, and other items.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, corner tables, furniture for electronics equipment and televisions, and other items.

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
Elesia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sacks of rice to sell to customers.

Elesia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Elesia's business profile again for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 25 years old. She is married with 2 children, aged 3 and 7, one of whom goes to school. 

Vestine sells shoes and has been in business for 4 years. With this loan, she would like to purchase more shoes to sell.  

The profits from the business will be used to increase her standard of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family. Shaheen is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of clothes, and machine oil, for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories, and will also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y ser una excelente profesional.
Ella esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y se esta esforzando mucho para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo y seguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Ana is from the city of Carapeguá. She is a person who is striving to get ahead so that she can become a successful professional. Ana is studying for a degree in Accounting. She is giving her best effort so that she can make something of her life.

Ana is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. This will enable her to continue studying just as before and to keep pursuing her dreams.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and married with four children who are in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Luz Marie

texts.en:
Luz Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, milk, flour, etc. for her food vending business.

Luz Marie has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from rice retailing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, milk, flour, etc

loans.name: Yanira Del Socorro

texts.es: Hace diez años que Yanira cuenta con pulpería propia, esta se la heredo su mama cuando tenía 34 años de edad. Su esposo ha sido su principal soporte para mantener la pulpería en marcha. Tiene cuatro hijos pero solamente dos a su cargo. Solicita el crédito para aumentar el inventario de su pulpería, así podrá comprar Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Jabón, Refrescos entre otros productos. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta hacer más grande su negocio y mejorar su infraestructura hasta lograr convertirlo en un minisúper.
texts.en:
For the past ten years, Yanira has had her own small grocery store. She inherited it from her mother when she was 34 years old. Her husband has been her main source of support to keep the small grocery store running. She has four children, but only two are under her care. 

She is requesting a loan to increase the stock of her small grocery store. She will buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, beverages, and other products. Among her future plans, she hopes to expand her business and improve its infrastructure until she is able to turn her small grocery store into a convenience store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the irrigation system on his agricultural land.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa is a 28-year-old mother with two children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Temukisa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and fry pan to assist her in running the business.

She hopes to use her profit to build small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and fry pan.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Melinda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase a new variety of vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

Melinda has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 26 years old, single, and has two children.

Eugene is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Eugene requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eugene has been in business for 1 year now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eugene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kikongo Women Group

texts.en: Connie is a forty-year-old female. She is married and has four children. She is a member of Kikongo Women Group, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Connie is a poultry farmer. She has been in poultry farming for five years, and has managed to build rentals out of it. Connie also grows crops such as maize, rice, cotton and others to get additional income. Connie has a dream of expanding her poultry project. However, she is faced with a challenge of disease and limited capital. Connie will use the loan to buy more chicks.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for rearing to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 43-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task. Now her husband has just started to drive a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bear the jerks over the roads. Now, the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his Moto Rickshaw.

Yasmeen has requested a loan so that her husband can buy the moto rickshaw body and drive it smoothly. 

Yasmeen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 46 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jasmin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Jasmin would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. 

Therefore, Sumaira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him continue with his business. Sumaira is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Hilda Guadalupe

texts.es: Hilda posee desde hace varios años un bazar ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vende una variedad de productos, por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa, lociones, cremas, juguetes, piñatas, etc. para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Hilda runs a shop located in her home. She sells a variety of products, so she has many customers. She is able to succeed with the earnings she makes from sales. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing, lotions, creams, toys, piñatas, etc. in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: purchase clothing, lotions, creams, toys and piñatas,etc.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Kalsoom's son has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer for a very low price. He now wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but is still short of the full amount.

Kalsoom's son is unable to earn a single penny for his family without a rickshaw. Kalsoom has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan amount, her son can easily buy a new rickshaw. Kalsoom and her son thank Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 36 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 42 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Fely has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Fely has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Luz Mary works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Luz Mary is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell of rice business.

Luz Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jesus Elizabeth

texts.es:
Todas las tardes, cuando el sol está de color naranja y a punto de esconderse para darle paso a la luna, Jesús arregla sus utensilios, los refrescos y la comida que ella vende para comenzar un día laboral para ella. Jesús es una mujer de 46 años, casada, con dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad quienes la ayudan en su negocio como comerciante desde que lo inició hace 18 meses. Antes ella se ganaba la vida vendiendo ropa de forma ambulante.
Jesús ahora, debido a su edad, comenzó a ahorrar para poder establecer con este reciente negocio. Ahora para seguir creciendo, ella solicita un crédito para comprar una freidora para poder facilitar la elaboración de las tajadas y los tacos fritos. Esto le ayudará a ofrecer más comida, cuidar su salud y generar mayores ingresos. En sus planes está vender pupusas para tener mayores ganancias y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Every afternoon, when the sun is orange and about to set in order to give way to the moon, Jesus arranges her utensils as well as the beverages and the food that she sells, and she begins her business day. Jesus is a 46-year-old, married woman with two children, who are 11 and 5 years old. Since she started her business 18 months ago, her children have helped her as merchants. Previously, she made a living selling clothes as a street vendor. 

As a result of her age, Jesus started saving in order to establish this new business. Now, in order to continue expanding, she is requesting a loan to buy a frier to help her make fried plantains and fried tacos. This will allow her to offer more food, stay healthy, and obtain greater earnings. She plans to sell stuffed tortillas in order to earn a higher income and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy a frier.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and is a married woman with six children. Three of her children are in school; she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Gina has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Gina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as carrots, peppers, meat, vegetables, etc., for her restaurant business.

Mildred has been in this business for 24 years. Mildred earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as carrots, peppers, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 29 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Josie works very hard to provide for them.

Josie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josie has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Josie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Misma

texts.en:
Misma works hard to support her family. Misma is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear clothes to sell.

Misma has been in this business for 12 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine ended her first Kiva loan, for which she is thankful and already hopes for a second partnership with Kiva lenders.

She lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik region. Here Armine lives with her two children. Her husband is still in Russian Federation and working there. He transfers money for his family’s needs, but as it was before now, that income is not constant. Also, Armine has to care for her farm properly since through the income from it, she solves her family’s many financial problems.

On her farm she has cows, bulls, calves, heifers, piglets, sheep, lambs, and chickens. From her farm, she sells a great range of dairy products, meat, eggs, and also potatoes that she cultivates on her plot of land. As she says, she works a lot and is ready to do more just to have better living conditions. She hopes that her husband will be finally come back, and they will together develop their farming.

She asks for this loan in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for the whole winter period, and also three more calves for her farm.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for the whole winter period, and also three more calves for her farm.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 3 children. She sells cereals in Machakos and has been in this business for 7 years. 

She plans to use this loan to purchase more stock of cereals, such as maize and beans, to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya.  Her future hopes are to expand her businesses, make more income and be self-sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.es:
Ladislao, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de 25 años y procreó dos  hijos, su esposa es ama de casa, sus dos hijos viven con él y trabajan en un taller de mecánica.

Él es agricultor, tiene más de 20 años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño le enseño que la vida solo se vivía bien, si trabajaba honradamente.- También tiene un camión de carga, el cual también le genera ingresos ya que trabaja con un ferretería cuando hay trabajo y además, cuando alguien lo busca para que le ayude a trabajar también lo hace.

La distancia que recorre es variable ya que no siempre va al mismo lugar, cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás lo deja para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el trabajo en la agricultura lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.

El préstamo será para comprar leña y venderla, ésta actividad es una fuente de ingreso bastante buena, por lo que se va a dedicar solo a este trabajo. El préstamo mejorará sus condiciones de vida. 

El sueño de Ladislao es, que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria y que sean profesionales de éxito.-
texts.en:
Ladislao is 47 years old and studied until the 6th grade.  He got married at 25 and had two children.  His wife is a housewife and their two children live with him and work in a mechanic's shop.

He has been a farmer for 20 years, and his father taught him when he was little that you can only live a good life if you work honorably.  He also has a cargo truck that generates some income for him since he does work for a hardware store when it is available, and also when someone seeks him out to help them with some work.  

The distance that he travels varies because he doesn't always go to the same place.  When he harvests his crops,  he sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest of it for personal consumption.  No one else is involved in his business activity. He works from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.

The loan will go towards buying firewood and selling it.  He is going to dedicate himself solely to this activity since it is a fairly good source of income.  The loan will improve his living conditions.  Ladislao's dream is that his children get university degrees and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy firewood and sell it

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad de 64 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 30, 32, y 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado de educación básica, su esposo es comerciante de ropa, además de su esposo con ella viven dos hijos y tres nietos pero de ella depende solo una persona.

Trinidad es comerciante, tiene una pupuseria desde hace 6 años, la inició incentivada por una amiga, su negocio queda a 5 minutos caminando desde su casa, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 12:00 m. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar sillas, banquitos y reparar el techo del local para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, además sueña con mantener la estabilidad de su negocio para dar lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Trinidad, 64, is married and has four children, ages 26, 30, 32, and 34.  She studied up to second grade.  Her husband sells clothing.  Her husband as well as two children and three grandchildren live with her, but only one person is dependent on her.
