Trinidad's a merchant.  She has had a pupusa business for six years.  A friend inspired her to start the business, which is a five-minute walk from her house.  She works from 7 a.m. until 12 noon.

She's requesting the loan to buy chairs and stools and to repair the roof of her retail space so she can provide her customers with better service.

Trinidad dreams of having stability in her business so she can give her family the necessities.

loans.use: to buy chairs and stools and to repair the roof of her retail space

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Su familia es unida, vive en casa familiar con su suegra, cónyuge y 03 hijas en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, patos y cerdos, desde hace casi 03 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a prestar servicios como ayudante de albañilería (construcción) por su zona de residencia y alrededores. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales, así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Heriberto espera mejorar la producción de su negocio, ofreciendo un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en: Heriberto is 37 years old and lives in a common law marriage. His family is tight. He lives in his house with his mother in law, wife and 3 daughters in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the Northern coast of Peru. The main activities in this district are agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. He has worked raising and selling small animals, such as guinea pigs, ducks, and pigs for almost 3 years. His business is located in his own house. Additionally, he works offering services as a construction worker around his house and surrounding areas. He has good personal and work references in his area. He will use the current loan to buy a larger quantity of animals, as well as balanced food to fatten them. With this, Heriberto hopes to improve the production of his business, offering a better quality product to his customers, which will generate a larger income and therefore, will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals, as well as balanced food to fatten them.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Grace is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lalaine is 34 years old and two of her children are in school.

Lalaine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lalaine has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lalaine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan Ramón: Es un joven agricultor de 22 años de edad, casado, con un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Desde que era casi un niño  se dedicó a la agricultura y ganadería, apoyando a sus padres en la finca que tienen en la comunidad de Columbus, que  se localiza a 95 kilómetros de Bilwi. Solicita su primer crédito para poder realizar dos actividades: Sembrar maíz y frijoles y  comprar cerdos para engorde y luego comercializarlos. Su sueño es tener su propia finca, en donde pueda continuar dedicándose a las actividades agrícolas y pecuarias; poder ahorrar para comprar un terreno y construir su  vivienda donde pueda vivir con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón, 22, is a young farmer.  He's married and has a four-year-old little boy.  He has worked in farming and ranching since he was practically a child, helping his parents in the farm they have in the community of Columbus, located 95 kilometers from Bilwi.

He's requesting his first loan to be able to do two things: grow corn and beans and buy pigs to fatten and sell.

Juan Ramón's dream is to have his own farm where he can keep on working in farming and ranching, save money to buy a plot of land, and build his home where he can live with his small family.

loans.use: to plant corn and beans and to buy pigs to fatten and sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 67 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el Distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte mediante su mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio a sus clientes. Con esto Eduardo busca brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, incrementando así su nivel de ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 67 years old and lives in his own home in Cayalti district. This community has a warm climate and its inhabitants work in farming, business, and cattle. The community is located in Chiclayo provincce, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides transportation service with his motortaxi, transporting passengers between neighborhoods and villages in his district. He seeks a loan to buy parts for his vehicle and in this way continue providing service to his customers. With this Eduardo seeks to provide better service to his customers, increasing his level of income and improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle and in this way continue providing service to his customers.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia has started her small business and become successful in managing her sari-sari (small grocery store). 

She has to ensure enough inventory to serve her customers well. She rolls up her capital and additional revenue to gain more profit. Every day, she makes good sales, since her store is located in a populous area in her barangay (village). 

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Ma. Jory

texts.en:
Ma. Jory is 44 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ma. Jory has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, canned  goods, eggs, milk, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Ma. Leny

texts.en:
Ma. Leny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Ma. Leny has been in this business for three years. Ma. Leny earns more income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell of rice business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for four years. Luzviminda earns more income from buy and sell of rice grains.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, and sand.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  27, 25, 21 y 19 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en universidad y son los que aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña María junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de caramelos y confitería al por mayor, trabajan todos los días, ellos se desplazan hasta la distribuidora de estos productos para luego ir entregando en tiendas y locales de la localidad y sitios aledaños que ya son clientes de ellos durante muchos años, son más de 30 años que él se dedica a esto y ella le acompaña casi todo este tiempo, así ellos se ganan el sustento diario de sus familia trabajando honradamente. 
Este crédito lo van a utilizar en comprar confitería y caramelos para seguir con su negocio. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
San Andrés Community Bank meets every two weeks in the Leonidas Proaño community in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that people visit year-round and for being a city of incomparable beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

María, 45, lives there.  She's married and has four children, ages 27, 25, 21, and 19.  The two younger ones are in college and still live with her.  Her husband's a merchant.

María and her husband earn a living selling candy and sweets wholesale.  They work every day, going to distributors of these products and then delivering to stores and locations in the area and in nearby places that have been customers for many years.  He has been in this business for more than 30 years and María has helped him all this time, earning their family's daily bread by working honestly every day.

She's going to use this loan to buy sweets and candy to continue with her business.

She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the benefits she receives from the bank.  Her dream is to make progress with improving her business.

loans.use: to buy candy and sweets

loans.name: Basema

texts.en:
Basema, 49, is married and from Tubas, a village near Nablus City. She has a grocery store in the village, where she sells basic groceries and candy for children. This is a good business, and she earns a good income, but it still needs to be improved.
 
Basema has taken out a loan for $1,500 (USD) with Palestine for Credit and Development. The loan will help her buy more grocery products, like rice and milk, to sell in her store. This investment will help her increase her sales and also her income.
 
Basema appears in the photo in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products, like rice and milk, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé de cinq  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 44ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du bois de chauffe, des condiments, des habits industriels et des parures. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adam    (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe   dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Djicoroni à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame  Adam   espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma  group is comprised of five women who are married and who are, for the most part, in monogamous relationships. On average, they are 44 years old and have four children. They live in Djicoroni, a neighborhood in Bamako. They know one another through neighbors. 

The group members have a small business selling firewood, condiments, clothing, and jewelry. With the goal of increasing their cash reserves, the group  decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their third group loan. 

Madame Adam (pictured second from the left) is well-known for her firewood sales. She would like to use her loan to buy one truckload of firewood in the neighboring villages of Bamako. She resells her goods for retail prices in Djicoroni to a predominantly female clientele.

With her loan, Madame Adam would like to earn an average monthly income of 45,000 FCFA that she will use to reinvest in her business.  With this loan, her goal is to buy a plot of land that she can live on.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 42-years-old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margie has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Margie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sindjiya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Sindjiya est constitué de cinq femmes  tous mariées et vie majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de  Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce  tel que la vente de, friperies, encens, biscuits, charbon de bois et chaussures.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  il y a de cela un mois et sont à leur 1ier   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Fanta (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des friperies. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine. La revente s’effectue à Daoudabougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fanta compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Sindjiya group is comprised of five women who are married, and who are, for the most part, in monogamous relationships. On average, they are 30 years old and have two children. They live Daoudabougou, a neighborhood in Bamako.

They know one another through local saving groups and their revenue-generating activities. The group members sell second-hand clothing, incense, cookies, charcoal, and shoes. With the goal of increasing their business assets, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso a month ago. This is their first group loan.

Madame Fanta (pictured second from the right) is well known for her second-hand clothing sales. She would like to use this loan to buy two bails of second-hand clothing. They buy their supplies in Médine. They sell their clothes in Daoudabougou for cash to a clientele that is predominantly female. 

With this loan, Madame Fanta would like to earn an average monthly profit 40,000 FCFA that she will use to meet her children’s needs and reinvest in her business. Madame relies heavily upon her partnership Soro Yiriwaso to achieve her goal of growing her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Eusebio Salomon

texts.es: El Sr. Eusebio tiene 23 años,  tiene un  hijo de la edad de tres años, sigue con la actividad de carpintero el se dedica a la construcción de puertas y muebles,  tiene su carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Puerto Rico de la ciudad de Santa Cruz se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 6 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Eusebio cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior préstamo ya que o utilizo en la compra de un motor eléctrico para mejorar su actividad, en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta para transportarse ya que las distancias de lugar a lugar son muy largas y esto facilitara mucho para ir a comprar madera o realizar sus entregas,  esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado porque con el préstamo mejoro bastante su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eusebio, 23, has a three-year-old child.  He still works as a carpenter building doors and furniture.  His shop is located in the Puerto Rico area of the city of Santa Cruz.  He has worked in this business for six years now; he learned the work from his father, who was also a carpenter.

This is his second loan sequence with the institution.  He said the previous loan went well for him because he used it to buy an electric motor to improve his work.  This time he's asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle to get around, because the distances from place to place are very long.  The motorcycle will make it easier to go buy wood or deliver his orders.

This is the only job that allows Eusebio to support himself and his family.  That's why he's happy and grateful to the institution for the help offered, because he improved his quality of life a lot with the loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: St.noah Development Group

texts.en:
Gorret is a thirty year old single mother with two children, ages 6 and 4 years living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She operates a bar business and does commercial farming growing tea for supplementary income. She has asked for a loan to buy beers to sell this festive season when demand is high. Gorret desires to build her own home with her two children and pay their school fees despite the challenges of  limited capital. 

She is a member of St Noah Development Group where members guarantee each other for a loan since they don’t pledge securities for the loan. Gorret requests the loan to buy more beers for selling.

loans.use: To buy more beers for selling

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is married with five children, and the family lives in Lopez Jaena, Philippines. He is a diligent and determined father when it comes to the welfare of his family, and he has always been known to provide the best for them. Edgardo earns a living by making snacks that he sells and also on consignment in shops and cafes. 

He decided to expand his business after learning that he could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, he has requested a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. His goal is to be able to display his snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of his wife, Edgardo smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to increase production

loans.name: Donatien

texts.en:
Donatien, 23, is not married. He has a shop and has been in business for four years. 

With this loan, he would like to buy lotions, soaps and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and open a store.

loans.use: To buy lotions, soaps and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, 72, lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four adult children. 

Sofia is engaged in cooking and vending snacks, particularly sweet potato and banana cue (fritters). She has also been engaged in the dressmaking business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos each month from her business activity. 

Sofia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost five years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock of sweet potatoes, bananas, sugar and oil for her cue cooking and vending business.

In the future, she hopes to expand her cooking and vending business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of sweet potatoes, bananas, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Myca

texts.en:
Myca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Myca has been in this business for 25 years. Myca earns more income from pig fattening.

Myca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es: Erika es una joven muy alegre y amorosa con su hijo de 5 años, comenta que en la actualidad está separada de su esposo y que es ella quien se hace cargo de todo gasto de su hijo  y sobre todo con su educación, ella se dedica a trabajar de peluquera y sus días libres se dedica a la  venta de ropa ofreciendo a sus amigas, vecinas y clientas, por este motivo el crédito necesita para comprar ropa, Erika espera que su negocio mejore y así seguir estando alegre con su hijo.
texts.en:
Erika is a cheerful young woman who is very affectionate with her 5-year-old son. She says that she is currently separated from her husband and that she is the one who is responsible for all her son's expenses and, above all, his education. 

She earns her living working as a hair stylist. On her days off, she works selling clothing to her friends, neighbors, and clients. 

That's why she needs the loan to buy clothing. Erika expects that her business will improve, and that she and her son will continue being happy.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Laarni is 39 years old and all of her children are in school.

Laarni has a buy and sell of home products business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Laarni requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to restart her business activities.

Laarni has been in this business for eight years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Laarni would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Jezeibel

texts.en:
Jezeibel is 35 years old and married with four children, who are all attending school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jezeibel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jezeibel has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years and earns more income from buy-and-sell rice and a general store.

She is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 48 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

Perlita has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of seven children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Lydia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 38 years old and a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercy has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Mercy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Rebecca has been farming sugarcane for 26 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Rachel

texts.en:
Ma. Rachel is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, who are all attending school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Rachel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Rachel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Rachel has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 45 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Rita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing for 15 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school. Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, canned goods, flour, etc. for her food vending business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years. Rosemarie earns more income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, canned goods, flour, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Maming

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maming works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.  Maming is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maming has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 45 years old and is married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ritchel has a buying and selling livestock business in the Philippines. Ritchel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy and sell more livestock.

Ritchel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy and sell more livestock

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita has recently signed up her membership in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

Jovita is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to purchase store inventories to increase her stock and to be able to meet customers' demand. Jovita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase store inventories to increase stocks and able to meet customers' demand

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 50 years old. She is a married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Merlita has a rice retail business in the Philippines. Merlita requested a 14000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Merlita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann is 32 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Cherry Ann has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cherry Ann requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Cherry Ann has been in this business for six years. In the future, Cherry Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. 

Ma. Luisa is borrowing 11000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell for her business.

Ma. Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine.  Analiza is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gentlemen's shoes.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en: Augustin is 33 years old. He is married with one child who is three years old. He has a shop and has been in a business for 28 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cortex, umbrellas, and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more cortex, umbrellas, and soap to sell at his shop.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and corn.  Wilma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell for her buy and sell herbal medicine business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a 68-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been running a sewing business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Leticia is asking for a loan to buy materials for sewing like cloth, thread, needles and other items. With a loan, she will be able to cater to more customers in her sewing shop.

In the future, Leticia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing like cloth, thread. and needles

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila: Es una señora agricultora de la comunidad Columbus; es muy amable, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, su esposo también es agricultor. Ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, cerdos, chompipes (pavos), que comercializa y puede aportar económicamente en el hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar cerdos lechones, para engordarlos y comercializarlos. Su sueño es tener una finca diversificada y con mayores rendimientos productivos.
texts.en: Petronila is a farmer woman from the community of Columbus.  She is very friendly.  She is 53 years old, married, and has four adult children.  Her husband is also a farmer.  She works raising chickens, pigs, and turkeys, which she sells to be able to contribute economically to the home.  She is requesting funding to buy piglets, so she can fatten them up and sell them.  Her dream is to have a diversified farm with a better yield of product.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Regin

texts.en: Regin is a businesswoman in Lopez Jaena. She is 23 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Regin runs a retail store selling "amakan" for house walling. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bamboo poles to be used for "amakan" weaving to sell. Regin believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo poles to be used for "amakan" weaving to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old. She is married to Charles and together they support their three children. Esther is a farmer who plants and sells groceries, a business she has done for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,200. She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,000 that she will use to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

With the anticipated profits, Esther will be able to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to become self reliant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 63 years old and single. Her major source of income comes from selling grocery items, which she has been doing  for more than three decades. The business helped her meet her financial needs. The business provides with a good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her nephews and nieces. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. 

Virgenia requested a loan, which she will use to purchase additional stocks for her grocery store. She is planning a business expansion so that she can  help her nieces in their college education.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Martha, a very hardworking mother who is 52 years of age. She is a small holder farmer from Sigowet, a remote village in the fertile Kericho area of Kenya. This charming mother has been engaged in mixed farming for the past 10 years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main source of income has been eggs, milk, tea, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kericho. Martha has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand is so high. 

Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry business. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Martha will achieve their dreams and goals. Martha believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan. Martha needs your support urgently as she only has this business with which to generate major income.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for her farming business.

loans.name: Concolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 58 years old and a widow with six children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Consolacion has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from recycled materials and tricycle passenger.

Consolacion aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rebecca is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rebecca has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Rebecca has been in this business for six years. Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Estela has been in this business for one year. Estela earns more income from buy and sell fish and a videoke machine.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, eggs, milk, etc. for her food vending business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past six  loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a widow mother of three children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a making and selling peanut butter business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Fe is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her peanut butter making business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her peanut butter making.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Lucia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like pants, shorts, etc. to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear products business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like pants, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
MANUEL DE VEINTICINCO AÑOS DE EDAD,  UN JOVEN SOLTERO SIN HIJOS, ES ORIGINARIO DE  MANAGUA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, EMPRENDEDOR,  CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO TERMINAR SUS ESTUDIOS, YA QUE SE VIO OBLIGADO A TRABAJAR PAR MANTENERSE ECONÓMICAMENTE Y AYUDAR A A SU FAMILIA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA UNA PEQUEÑA FERRETERÍA, UBICADA EN UNOS DE LOS MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD,  TIENE NUEVE AÑOS DE DESEMPEÑARSE EN DICHA ACTIVIDAD, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTE JOVEN ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTOS, YA QUE TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES SURTIR SU NEGOCIO, HACER CRECER SU CLIENTELA Y SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES, POR TAL MOTIVO NECESITA INVERTIR EN PRODUCTOS DE FERRETERÍA COMO:  LLAVES, MANGUERAS, ZINC, CLAVOS, PALA, HACHAS, PINTURAS, CODOS, RASTRILLOS ,EXTENSIONES, CANDADOS, HERRAMIENTAS, TORNILLOS ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. MANUEL AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Manuel, 25, is single and has no children.  His a native of Managua, and is known for being an enterprising and hardworking person who has a desire for personal success.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to complete his education, as he needed to work to support himself financially and help his family.

Because of his desire to get ahead, he has a small hardware store located in one of the markets in the town.  He's been doing this work for 9 years, and his work routine is to offer his products for sale 12 hours a day, as there is a lot of competition in this business.  Manuel is taking this loan to stock up his business so that he can attract more customers and satisfy their demands.  For this reason, he needs to invest in hardware products such as: keys, hoses, sheets of corrugated metal, nails, shovels, axes, paints, pipes, rakes, extension cords, padlocks, tools, screws, etc, so that in the near future he can obtain more income.  

Manuel thanks the Kiva lenders for the help that they are providing to low income people in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to stock his hardware store

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Badegna ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kalaban Coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (aubergine), tubercules, bananes plantains et poisson. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Niamoye  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (aubergine). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs  d’aubergines à Médine. La revente se fait en détails  Kalaban Coura à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Niamoye  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women of the Badenga group are in polygamous marriages. On average, they are 35 years old and have four children. They all live in Kalaban Coura, a neighborhood in Bamako. They know one another through neighbors and their revenue-generating activities in Kalaban Coura. 

The group members sell eggplants, tubers, plantains, and fish. With the goal of increasing their business assets, the members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their second group loan cycle. 

Madame Niamoye  (pictured at left) is a well-known eggplant saleswoman. She would like to use her loan to buy four bags of eggplants in Médine. She resells them for retail prices in Kalaban Coura to a clientele that is predominantly female. 

With this loan, Madame Niamoye would like to earn an average monthly income of 50,000 FCFA that she’ll use to reinvest in her business and meet her household needs.

loans.use: buy condiments.

loans.name: Lynettemy

texts.en: Lynettemy is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business with her husband for more than three years now. This is the source of their income. Lynettemy is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle, thus allowing them to transport passengers from one place to another.  In the future, Lynettemy hopes to improve their livelihood. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en: Agripina, an industrious widow, is responsible and dedicated to her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater to her tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor, de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada desde los 20 años, su pareja es albañil, cuando no trabaja en la albañilería, le ayuda a su esposa con su trabajo, tiene dos hijos, una hija de 24 años que ya no estudia y el otro hijo de 16 años que estudia bachillerato.  

Ella es comerciante, tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras en el mercado, ya tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio, desde pequeña su madre le enseño este oficio. La distancia que recorre es de 1 kilómetro, el recorrido lo realiza en moto taxis, su horario es de las 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.  

El préstamo será invertido para comprar  más mercadería como papaya, mangos, zapotes, tomates, cebollas, chiles, entre otros. Ya que estamos en época de fin de año y las ventas aumentan considerablemente.

El préstamo  le permitirá que pueda aumentar sus ventas y ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, con lo que esta aportado más a los gatos del hogar y a cubrir compromisos.

El sueño de Flor es, poder tener un puesto más grande, con el que pueda darle el sustento a su familia siempre.
texts.en:
Flor, age 42, went to school through ninth grade.  She has been in a relationship since she was 20.  Her partner is a bricklayer.  When he’s not working in bricklaying, he helps her with her work.  She has two children, a 24-year-old daughter who is not in school anymore and a 16-year-old son in secondary school.

She is a businesswoman, and has a fruit and vegetable stand in the market.  She has worked in this business for over twenty years now.  When she was young, her mother taught her this trade.  She commutes a distance of 1 kilometer, and makes this commute by moto-taxi.  Her schedule is from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m.

The loan will be invested to buy more merchandise, such as papayas, mangoes, sapotas, tomatoes, onions, and chiles, among others.  Since it is currently the end of the year, sales increase considerably.

The loan will allow her to increase her sales and offer more variety of product to her customers.  This will let her contribute more to household expenses and to fulfill her commitments.

Flor’s dream is to be able to have a larger stand, with which she will always be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as papayas, mangoes, sapotas, tomatoes, onions, and chiles, among others.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old and married with five children.  With five children currently in school, Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, beers, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, beers, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, beers, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nancy has been in this business for three years. Nancy earns more income from rice retailing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years old and married with one child.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

Nancy has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Nancy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown up children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has engaged in the rice retailing business for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. With a loan, Norma will be able to improve her rice stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

In the future, she hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the reinvestment of the same business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Marygen

texts.en:
Marygen has mastered her hog raising business in Plaridel, Philippines. This is how she makes a living, supporting her husband for their family. 

She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail credit to fully support her business. 

Just as she takes care of her hog raising business, so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of PHP 30,000 will help her build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment. Someday, Marygen hopes to open a meat shop along the highway.

loans.use: build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely has been thoughtfully preparing for the post-harvest operations of her palay (unhusked rice) in Unidos, Plaridel, Philippines. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage, and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan. Fely hopes for nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with adequate income from her business for their daily needs and future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: In the year 2012, Olivia learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Liloy, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her rice production business. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Olivia feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Olivia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 74 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with eight adult children. Rita is earning income from her monthly pension as a surviving spouse for more than 20 years already. She is also earning income from their parcel of rice farmland. She earns approximately PHP 2,100 each month doing this type of business activities. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing fertilizers and sprays for her rice production activity. Rita has been a member of PMPC for more than 10 years. She is very thankful to the cooperative for the products and services; she enjoys  particularly in insurances and savings. She wants to save more in the cooperative for future use.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and sprays for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, margarine, sugar, milk, etc. for her food vending business.

Thelma has been in this business for 10 years. Thelma earns more income from buy and sell herbal medicine.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, margarine, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Victoria is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 32 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jenalyn has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Salvacion is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mikole Twimuke Group

texts.en: Deo is a 44-year-old married man who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda with nine children. He trades in coffee beans and does farming for additional income. He started his business to earn income and be able to sustain his family’s increasing demands. Deo has a vision of building his own store in order to avoid the inconveniences of high license fees and rent. He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell. Deo is a member of Mikole Twimuke group where there is group guarantorship.

loans.use: To buy more coffee to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 37 years old and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with four school-aged children. She has a shop that sells different kinds of fruits and vegetables and has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan to buy variety of fruits to sell to provide the order of her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to provide for the financial needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Pioleta

texts.en:
Pioleta is married and has been a wholesaler of bananas in their town for almost ten years. From this long time experience of selling, she already has high knowledge in dealing in this kind of business. 

Even though there are many competitors in the town, Pioleta still gets more customers than the rest, due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. 

For now, Pioleta is planning to make and sell banana snacks in order for her to gain more profit. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 100 kilos of bananas for wholesale and banana snacks to sell, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kilos of bananas for wholesale and banana snacks to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. 

She has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her piglets. Narcisa wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her piglets

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is a hardworking mother from Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 65 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Trinidad has signed her membership with the Cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Trinidad hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Babylin

texts.en:
Babylin is 34 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. Together with her husband, Babylin is engaged in a fishing activity. They sell their catch at the market and to their neighborhood. The family earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month, doing this work.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing marine ply boards, marine nails, marine epoxy, and paints for their boat repairs. Babylin has been a member of PMPC for seven years already. In the future, Babylin hopes to acquire additional fishing boats.

loans.use: purchase marine ply boards, marine nails, marine epoxy, and paints for her boat repairs

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Mercedita is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nyabuliko Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Richard, who is a cattle trader, is a single parent with eight children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He also does farming to supplement his incomes. 

He ventured into business so as to support his children since he is their only hope. Richard hopes to engage himself in commercial farming despite the complaints of traveling long distances looking for animals and the poor weather conditions, especially in the rainy season when his sales are low. 

Richard will use the loan to buy cows for slaughtering to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughtering to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 37 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nelly has been in this business for three years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Lopez Jaena in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Estella has been able to send all her children to school and provide for all their needs. Out of the money she has saved, Estella purchased a two-hectare plot. Now, she wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts of a good variety so she can increase her farm's yield. However, Estella is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings. Estella has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 12 y 3 años, y su negocio es el comercio de camélidos (llamas).
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Hichocota’ ubicado en cercanías del lago sagrado Titicaca, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados, y donde los rayos solares son extremadamente fuertes.
Dionicia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y para realizar comercio en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y ayudan con los negocios, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de paja que cuenta con electricidad y agua de  pozo. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado camélido, como llamas y alpacas. Ella se ocupa de comprar ganado para realizar su engorde, una vez que el ganado ha crecido en tamaño, peso y pelo, se ocupa de su comercio en diferentes ferias ganaderas del lugar y comunidades vecinas. “las llamas, vicuñas y alpacas son muy utilizadas por su pelaje, por su carne y el por instinto guardián que reflejan al cuidado de un rebaño…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su establo para contar con más espacio para criar ganado. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de llamas para realizar su engorde, debido a la época de lluvias que se aproxima y con eso el crecimiento de pajonales y alimentos para ganado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Dionicia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado camélido para su engorde debido a la temporada de lluvias.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a forty-seven-year-old woman. She is married and has five children who are 18, 16, 14, 12, and 3 years old. Her business is the sale of camelidae (llamas).

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, joyful, optimistic, happy, and has a good attitude. She is responsible and is a hard worker. She carries out her business in the community of Hichocota located near the sacred Lake Titicaca. It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies between 2 and 12 degrees centigrade and the rays of the sun are extremely strong there.

Dionicia is dark skinned with long, black, braided hair. Her clothing is traditional (hat, shawl, and pollera [Andean skirt]). Her native language is Aymará which she speaks in her area. She also speaks Spanish as a result of the general society and to conduct business in the city. She spends her life with her husband, who makes a living in agriculture, and her children who study at the school and help with the businesses. They live in their own home made of adobe with a straw roof. The house has electricity and well water.

Her business is the sale of camelidae livestock like llamas and alpacas. She buys the livestock to fatten them up and once they have grown in size, weight, and their fur has grown, she sells them at different livestock markets in the are and neighboring communities. "The llamas, vicunas, and alpacas are used for the fur, their meat, and for their guarding instincts that is reflected in their care for flocks..." she says.

Her dream is to improve her stable to have more space to raise cattle. She wants to invest in the business through the purchase of llamas to fatten them up since the rainy season is coming and with it the growth of the scrubland and feed for the livestock. This is her first loan with the institution after 30 years carrying out this business independently.

It is for these reasons that Dionicia is requesting a loan to buy camelidae livestock to fatten them up since it is the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy camelidae livestock to fatten due to the rainy season.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is an industrious mother living in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is 60-year-old married woman with six grown children. 

She has been engaged in selling bread and home made meals like pansit (very thin rice noodles fried with soy sauce some citrus, possibly with patis, and some variation of sliced meat and chopped vegetables). She sells it to the locals  in her community. 

In order to augment her income, she also raises and sells hogs. She has been engaged in this kind of business for ten years already.

Paulita is asking a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy more bread and pancit to resell. This will help Paulita sell more food to increase  her daily income. She could now provide more  supplies to her customers.

In the future, Paulita dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more bread and pancit  to resell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence has a grocery business in Machakos town and has been running this business for four years now. She is 39 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. She will use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children. This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be prosperous.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell at her grocery store.

loans.name: Fenes

texts.en:
Fenes is 26 years old, married, and together with her spouse blessed with one child. She has a grocery business and has been in the business for four years now. Right now she makes a monthly income of KES 7,200. 

She will be using this loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her grocery business. 

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, having paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and become self-sustaining.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy Jr.

texts.en:
Jimmy Jr. believes education is a key to succeed in life. He wants to earn a degree and become a successful engineer. 

He wants to help his family and his siblings to finish their education also. With the loan of PHP 5,690, he will be able to pay for the tuition and graduation costs. 

He is about to finish his course but would need to fully pay the school fees. Jimmy Jr. sees himself to be in a position to help others too in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and graduation costs

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 65 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children now at their adult age. 

Celso has been engaged in farming, particularly rice production for more than 40 years already. He earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also receiving a monthly pension from one of the government’s security agencies of the country. 

He has requested a loan to purchase four sacks of commercial fertilizers and insecticide sprays for his rice production activity. Celso has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, he hopes to acquire an additional parcel of riceland.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of commercial fertilizers and insecticide sprays

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Geovanna Pilar

texts.es: Pilar es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad  y con su madre quien le apoya en el cuidado de sus hijos, Pilar tiene 22 años y se dedica  atrabajar al jornal y comenta que en ocasiones que su madre está muy ocupada y no le cuida a sus hijos, Pilar tiene que llevarles a sus hijos a trabajar en el jornal de trabajos de agricultura, Pilar se dedica  a la crianza de pollos y el crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos para tenerlos en la casa por la que paga arriendo y  que vive con  su madre, la aspiración de Pilar es mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando para sus hijos.
texts.en: Pilar is a single mother. She lives with her two children, who are 1 and 3 years old, and with her mother, who helps her care for her children. Pilar is 22 years old and works as a laborer. She explains that sometimes her mother is very busy and can't take care of the children, so Pilar has to take them to her job in agricultural work. Pilar raises chickens. She will use the loan to buy chickens so she can keep them at her home, which she rents and where she lives with her mother. Pilar aspires to improve her business and to keep working for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens.
