loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 53 years old. He is married to Faustina and together they have been blessed with five children. 

He is a farmer, a business he has done for the last 30 years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,200.

Robert has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000 which he will use to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

With the anticipated profits, Robert will be starting a business for his wife. His hopes and dreams for the future are to see his family prosper.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany has a retailing business in Plaridel, selling gasoline by bottles; each filled bottle contains one liter. 

Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her business. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more containers of gasoline for retail. 

She is adding an extension of gasoline retail store in a nearby barangay (village), and she wishes to earn more doing this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of gasoline for retail

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de huit femmes, les membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 47 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, draps de la friperie de plusieurs sortes et condiments. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme arrêtée en 3ème position de la droite vers gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de draps de la friperie de plusieurs sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 balles de friperie contenant des draps. Elles s’approvisionnent en draps à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Oumou compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 900 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Made up of eight women, the members of the Benkadi group are all married in polygamous households. They are on average 47 years old with six children. They all live in Kalaban-Coura, one of Bamako's neighborhoods. They became acquainted through family connections, neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities.

Group members sell various kinds of second-hand sheets and condiments. To build up their stock-in-trade, the group decided to make use of Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Oumou (the woman standing in the third position from right to left in the photo) is a great seller of different kinds of second-hand sheets. She plans to use her loan to buy three bales of used clothing containing sheets.

She resupplies with sheets in Medina. Retail sales are conducted in cash or on credit, as an itinerant vendor and sometimes on order, to a predominantly female clientele.

With this loan Mrs. Oumou expects to achieve average monthly profits of 900,000 CFA francs, which will be used to ensure her children's health care. She aims to increase the volume of her business through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy second-hand sheets

loans.name: Margarita Trinidad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive  la señorita Margarita, tiene 52 años de edad está soltera y vive con su mamá y varios sobrinos que son su alegría. 
Doña Margarita es una mujer muy luchadora que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella trabaja dos o tres horas al día. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The San Andrés Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the Leonidas Proaño community in the city of Manta.  It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which have a lot of visitors in all seasons of the year, and it’s known as a city with matchless beauty and with many attractive tourist sites.  

Margarita lives in this place.  She is 52, single, and lives with her mother and several nephews, who are her joy.

Margarita is a very determined woman who, in order to obtain her own resources and thereby get ahead, works selling clothing of all types and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories).  She sells door to door, and she works two to three hours each day.  She has worked in this activity for more than four years, and with it she earns a living. 

This loan is to buy clothing, perfume, creams, and cosmetics.  She has been in the Credit Group for four years, and she likes it because of the help that the loans provide.  Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gisella Estefania

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Gisella, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Gisella es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y con sus ingresos ayudarles a sus padres que son de escasos recursos a salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de  todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda, deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse la vida. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Andrés Credit Group meets every fifteen in the Leonidas Proaño community in the city of Manta.  It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are have a lot of visitors in all seasons of the year, and it’s known as a city with matchless beauty and with many attractive tourist sites.  

Gisella lives in this place.  She is 24, single, and lives in her parents’ house.

Gisella is a very determined woman who likes to support herself in order to get ahead and, with her income, to help her parents, since they have few resources with which to get ahead.  She works in sales, and she sells all kinds of clothing.  She sells door to door, and she also sells in her house, where her customers come when they need a garment.  She charges it on credit, and collects the payments each week.  She has worked in this activity for more than three years, and it allows her to earn a living.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments.  She has been in the Credit Group for three years, and she likes it because she started her business with the first loan.  Her dream is to carry on with her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments.

loans.name: Juana Clorinda

texts.es: JUANA CLORINDA: Es una señora jovial, líder comunitaria que se dedica a actividades agropecuarias;  tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad que ya son independientes.  Es de la comunidad de Nazareth que se localiza a 65 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, en el Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Ha recibido varias capacitaciones, en temas de manejo integral de cultivos, abonos orgánicos, que han impartido las organizaciones como PANA PANA, quien le otorgó un certificado como promotora agropecuaria, de su comunidad. El préstamo que ella está solicitando es para la siembra de frijol y maíz, engorde y comercialización de cerdo. Su sueño es tener una finca sostenible y diversificada, con buenos rendimientos y manejo agronómico de los cultivos; también quiere tener un buen corral para proteger el ganado y diversificar su producción.
texts.en:
Juana Clorinda is a jovial person, a community leader who works in agriculture. She is 58 years old and is the mother of 6 grown children who are economically independent. She lives in the community of Nazareth, which is located 65 kilometers from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She has received various trainings on the topics of integrated crop management and organic fertilizers, which have been put on by organizations such as Pana Pana, which granted her a certificate as an agricultural promoter in her community. 

The loan she is requesting is for planting beans and corn, and to fatten and sell pigs. Her dream is to have a sustainable and diversified farm, with good production and an agriculture science-based management of her crops. She also wants to have a good corral in order to protect her cattle and diversify her production.

loans.use: to plant beans and corn, and to fatten and sell pigs.

loans.name: Maria Elma

texts.en:
Maria Elma is 41 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maria Elma has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, spices, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items.

In the future Maria Elma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Denny Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Denny, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad. El marido trabaja en una empresa local. 
Doña Denny es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de  todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda, ella  deja a crédito a sus  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo ya que su marido no gana mucho en su trabajo. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante en su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Nueva Fortaleza Credit Group meets every fifteen in the Leonidas Proaño community in the city of Manta.  It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are have a lot of visitors in all seasons of the year, and it’s known as a city with matchless beauty and with many attractive tourist sites.  

Denny lives in this place.  She is 30, and has a common law marriage, from which she has one three-year-old son.  Her partner works in a local business.

Denny is a very determined woman who likes to support herself in order to get ahead and, with her income, to help her partner with household expenses.  She works in sales, and she sells all types of clothing.  She sells door to door, and she also sells in her house, where her customers come when they need a garment.  She charges it on credit, and collects the payments each week.  She has worked in this activity for more than two years, and it allows her to earn something, since her partner doesn’t earn much in his work.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments.  She has been in the Credit Group for three cycles, and she likes it because the loans allow her to move forward with her business.  Her dream is to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 57 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, sugar and other groceries.

In the future Juliet would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem started her cloth selling business at a young age to contribute in the family income as her husband's income was not sufficient to cover their family expenses. She is 32 and blessed with three children. Her dream is to give her children higher education. 

Her customers are mostly female. She wants to increase her business by offering more variety of clothes to her customers. But due to insufficient funds she has requested a micro finance loan from Brac Pakistan that she will repay with the sales of the clothes. 

Naseem wants her business to flourish and is working hard for the success of her small business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her cloth selling business

loans.name: Dianita

texts.en:
Dianita is 31 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Dianita works very hard to provide for her family.

Dianita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

Dianita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future Dianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Laïdou est constitué de sept femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente du, poisson, des œufs, des condiments, des pagnes wax, des friperies et des maïs frais.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Naha (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des poissons à Kalaban-coura. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 corbeilles de poissons. Elles s’approvisionnent  au Quartier du Fleuve. La revente s’effectue à Kalaban-coura  au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Naha compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group consists of seven women, all married and living in polygamous households. They are on average 37 years old with five children. They all live in Kalaban-Coura, one of Bamako's neighborhoods. They became acquainted through local tontines (savings groups) and their income-generating activities.

Group members are retail merchants selling fish, eggs, condiments, pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric), used clothing and fresh maize. To increase their working capital, group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan.

Mrs. Naha (the woman standing in second position from right to left in the photo) has a great reputation at selling fish in Kalaban-Coura. She plans to use the loan to buy two baskets of fish. She resupplies in the River District. Retail sales are conducted for cash in Kalaban-Coura to a predominantly female clientele.

With this loan Mrs. Naha hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs which will be used to meet her children's small needs. The remainder will be reinvested in her activities. She relies on the partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to achieve her objectives in expanding her business.

loans.use: buy fresh fish

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es:
Isolina tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, en la región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú. Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, etc. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad, con gran influencia en el negocio, Isolina piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, esto le generará un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isolina is 43 years old, has a spouse, she lives with her husband and her two younger children in a rural area in the Oyotun district, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru. The village people in this area work raising and selling animals.

She works raising and selling small animals such as ducks, hens, roosters, chickens, pigs, etc. Her business is located in her home. She has more than 5 years experience in this field and has very good work and personal references in the area.

The loan requested is to buy more animals, this investment will help her to have more variety and productivity. To have a big influence on her business, Isolina plans to increase her stock of animals to meet the various preferences and needs of her local customers. This will generate a higher income and therefore increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Proscopio Bolivar

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Bolívar, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos de  8 y 4 años y un bebé de 6 meses  de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela. La mujer es comerciante. 
El señor Bolivar es un hombre que le gusta trabajar, el se dedica a la albañilería y realiza el crédito para que su mujer lo utilice en su labor, ella se dedica a la venta de vropa interior y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que  son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Nueva Fortaleza [New Strength] Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the city of Leonidas Proaño in the Manta Canton, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited throughout all seasons of the year and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many attractive tourist sites.

This is the place where Bolivar lives. He is 35 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which he has 3 children of 8 and 4 years old and a baby of 6 months, the elder ones go to school. His wife is a merchant.

Bolivar is a man who likes to work. He works in bricklaying and is taking this loan for his wife who uses these products in her work. She works selling underwear and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works three days a week, three hours a day. She leaves her products on credit and charges once a week. She has been in this line of work for more than three years and it is going well. Her biggest sales come from the perfumes and cosmetics as they are very good.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear. This is the third loan they have taken with this communal bank and they like it because the payments are very easy to make. Their dreams are to give the best to their family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 67 years old and married with seven children. Matilde works very hard to provide for them.

Matilde runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Matilde has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soap, spices and other groceries.

In the future Matilde would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Sonia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more seaweed to sell for her buy and sell seaweed business.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en: Mukhtar is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last few years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Mukhtar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Mukhtar is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Elfrida Heroina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Elfrida, tiene 68 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 3 hijos mayores de edad, una hija aun viven en su casa.
Doña Elfrida junto a su hija tienen  en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedican a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ellas tienen contratos con una fabrica local a quienes les proveen de uniformes, lo cual es muy beneficiosos para ella ya que cuentan con trabajo asegurado en ciertas épocas del año, también trabajan a base de pedidos de personas particulares. Llevan más de 10 años con esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Nueva Fortaleza [New Strength] Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the city of Leonidas Proaño in the Manta Canton, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited throughout all seasons of the year and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many attractive tourist sites.

This is where Elfrida works, she is 68 years old, a few years ago her husband died and she was widowed but she has 3 children from the relationship who are grown up, one daughter still lives at home.

Elfrida and her daughter have a small dressmaking workshop in their house. There she works sewing all types of women's, men's and children's clothing. They have a contract with a local factory who they provide the uniforms for, which is very beneficial for her as she has guaranteed work during certain parts of the year. They also work based on orders from individuals. They have been in this business for more than 10 years which has allowed them to get through.

This new loan will be used to purchase fabrics and other materials for dressmaking. They have been in this communal bank since its inception and they like it because of the help the loans provide. Her dreams are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53 years old, widowed and has six children, two of whom are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 71 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, noodles, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Zenaida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a maize farmer from Dauro village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sunday would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sunday can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Sunday, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband sells window glass and also provides door to door services to fix the glass into windowpanes. 

A few days ago his most of the expensive glass had broken incidentally and now he is unable to provide his services smoothly. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy glasses and can continue his services.  

Razia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy windows glasses for services.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres  hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer tiene un tanquero.
Doña María es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de agua en tanquero, como por el sector por donde ellos viven no hay agua potable aprovecha su esposo para vender este liquido vital, el también lleva a otros lugares  apartados de la ciudad y a ciertas empresas de la localidad, vende ya sea por viajes o por tanques de acuerdo a la necesidad de  sus clientes. El lleva más de 30 años con esta actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar agua y combustibles para el tanquero. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les ha dado el banco. Sus sueños son comprar otro tanquero nuevo.
texts.en:
The Nueva Fortaleza [New Strength] Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the city of Leonidas Proaño in the Manta Canton, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited throughout all seasons of the year and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many attractive tourist sites. This is where Maria lives, she is 62 years old, married and has three grown-up children, two of her children still live at home. Her husband is a water tanker driver.

Maria is a very good wife who is taking out this loan for her husband's business which is selling water from a tanker, as in the area where they live there is no drinking water so her husband benefits from selling this vital liquid. He also takes it to other places outside the city and to certain local businesses, he sells by trip or by tank, according to his customers' needs. He has been in this business for 30 years which has gotten his family through.

This loan is to buy water and fuel for the tanker. She has been in this communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because of the help that the bank provides. Her dreams are to buy a new water tanker.

loans.use: to buy water and fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from tailoring.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 13 years, 3 of them go to school. 

Jonas sells food stuffs and has been in a business for 5 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beans, sorghum and soya beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and soya beans to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 50 años de edad, estudió hasta 3er grado de educación básica no continuó porque la escuela quedaba muy retirado, es ama de casa y tiene 4 hijos independientes que le apoyan económicamente. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar la mano de obra que necesitará para construir una habitación en su casa para tener mayor privacidad. Sueña con que Dios le preste vida y disfrutar sus nietos.
texts.en: Ana, 50, has a third grade education and was unable to continue because the school was very far from home.  She is a homemaker and has four independent children who help her economically.  The loan she is requesting is to buy construction materials and pay labor costs to build a room in her house for more privacy.  Her dream is to be blessed with a long life and to enjoy her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and pay labor costs to build a room.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. He does farming in Oloitoktok town where he grows cash crops for sell. Right now he makes a monthly income of KES 7,500 and his farming has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a generator for pumping water his farm. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Janice works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Janice is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Iliya is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elvia Marina

texts.es: Elvia de 51 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 6 hijos, estudió hasta 1er grado de educación básica, vive con tres hijos que son su única familia, su esposo murió hace 20 años, 3 de sus hijos están en el extranjero y le apoyan económicamente. Solicita el préstamo para pagar documentos legales acerca de su propiedad y comprar medicinas, sueña con preparase económicamente para no sentirse muy dependiente no tener que adquirir compromisos a menos que sea necesario.
texts.en: Elvia, 51, is a widow and the mother of six children.  She studied only to first grade and lives with three of her children.  Her husband passed away 20 years ago.  Three of her children live abroad and help her economically.  The loan she is requesting is to pay for legal documents related to her property and to buy medicines.  Her dream is to become more independent economically so she is not so dependent on others and not have to acquire commitments unless absolutely necessary.

loans.use: To pay for legal documents related to her property and to buy medicines.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos de 45 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, está acompañado y tiene una hija de 14 años de edad que estudia 8° grado de educación básica. Su pareja es empleada, trabaja en la alcaldía municipal de su municipio. Carlos es chofer de un microbús, se dedica al transporte de estudiantes desde hace 8 años, antes administraba una compañía de autobuses. Su horario de trabajo es variado pero es en horas de la mañana y de la tarde dependiendo del horario de los estudiantes.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y hacer el mantenimiento del microbús, al ser su herramienta de trabajo necesita tenerlo en las mejores condiciones para el próximo año escolar. Sus proyecciones son comprar un microbús más grande y para transportar más estudiantes y que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Carlos, 45, has a ninth grade education and lives with his partner and 14-year-old daughter, who is in the eighth grade.  His partner works at the mayor's office in their town.  Carlos drives a microbus and has been transporting students for eight years.  He used to work in administration for a bus company.  His schedule varies but he works in the morning and afternoon, depending on the students.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts and provide maintenance for his microbus.  Since it is his work tool he wants to keep it in top condition for the coming school year.  His goals include buying a larger microbus and transporting more students.  He also wants his daughter to have a professional career.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and provide maitenance for his microbus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy material and equipment to open a shoe shop.

loans.name: Sandra Yesenia

texts.es:
Sandra de 38 años de edad, terminó su carrera en la universidad, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que está estudiando, vive con su pareja, madre y hermana además de su hijo. Sandra trabaja como abogada, y desde hace 7 años tiene en su casa de habitación un despacho jurídico, se decidió por esta carrera porque siempre le gustaron las leyes o los trabajos que ellas conllevan.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer unas reparaciones a su casa que se ha deteriorado con el paso del tiempo, además quiere construir un lavadero con sus respectivos acabados. Sueña con que su hijo también sea un profesional y espera seguir trabajando duro para él.
texts.en:
Sandra, 38, has a university degree.  She and her common-law husband have a six-year-old son who attends school.  She lives with her husband, mother and sister and her sister's son.  Sandra is a lawyer and for seven years has been running her legal office from her home.  She decided on this career because of her fondness for the law and related work.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to make repairs in her home in areas that have deteriorated over time.  She also wants to build an adequately finished laundry area.  Her dream is for her son to become a professional and she hopes to continue working hard for him.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a laundry area and for repairs in the house.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 62 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajarmarca en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de reparación de equipos eléctricos, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de herramientas para implementar su negocio, con esto Miguel espera mejorar el servicio que brinda aumentando así su nivel de ingresos lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 62 years old and lives in a rented house with his partner and their youngest child in Pucará, Jaén province. Jaén is in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern coast. The people here mainly work in farming, trade and cattle-raising.

Miguel himself makes a living repairing electrical goods. He has experience with his business and has very good personal and professional references in the local area. This loan will be used to buy a larger number of tools for his business. With this loan Miguel hopes to improve the service that he offers at his business. This will result in an increased income, which will have a large impact on his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of tools for his business.

loans.name: Gilberto Alejandro

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Gilberto, tiene 65 años de edad, está separado y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, seis de ellos mayores de edad, el menor tiene 8 años  estudian en escuela y vive con la mamá pero depende de él. 
El señor Gilberto es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y darles a sus hijos lo necesario, el se dedica a la compra y venta de chanchos, se desplaza a los campos a comprar estos animalitos los mismos que luego los lleva al mercado local y vende a comerciantes del lugar a un precio razonable que le permita obtener buenas ganancias, en ocasiones el también faena los cerdos y vende la carne al público en general y vecinos de su zona, el  lleva más de 20 años con este negocio el mismo que les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar chanchos.  Lleva 6 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Fortaleza" group meets every fortnight in Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that receive many visitors throughout the year, and for being a beautiful city with many tourist attractions.

And it is here that 65-year-old Gilberto lives. He is separated and has seven children; six of his children are now adults while the youngest is eight years old and is in school. He lives with his mother but Gilberto supports him.

Gilberto likes to work in order to get ahead and provide his children with what they need. Gilberto makes a living buying a selling pigs. He goes out into the country to buy the animals himself, and then takes them to the local market to sell to local businesses for a reasonable price that allows him to make a good profit. Sometimes Gilberto also slaughters the pigs himself and sells the meat to consumers, and neighbours in his local area. Gilberto has had this business for 20 years and it allows him to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy pigs. Gilberto has been with the loan group during six cycles and he likes it because of the benefits from the organisation. Gilberto's dream is to maintain good health in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Estelia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 54 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en maquinarias pesadas.
Doña Rosa es una ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, perfumes, relojes, carteras, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  trabaja tres días a la semana realizando sus recorridos y también vende en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes si necesitan algún producto de los que ella vende, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  carteras, relojes, perfumes y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a aumentar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un carro para ir a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Fortaleza" group meets every fortnight in Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that receive many visitors throughout the year, and for being a beautiful city with many tourist attractions.

And it is here that 54-year-old Rosa lives. She is married and has six children, now independent adults. Rosa's husband works with heavy machinery.

Rosa is a housewife but to help her husband with household costs she also works selling all kinds of clothes, as well as shoes, perfumes, watches, purses and other items. She sells door-to-door three days per week. She also sells from her home where customers come to see her if they need a particular product. Rosa sells on credit, collecting payments every eight days. Rosa has been doing this work for more than four years and, with it, she earns a living to support her family.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, purses, watches, perfumes and shoes. Rosa has been with the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans have helped her to expand her business. Rosa's dreams are to buy a vehicle to use to go out and sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes, purses, watches, perfumes and shoes.

loans.name: Luis Gamaniel

texts.es:
Luis Gamaniel tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casado, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú, desde hace más de 20 años. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los habitantes de la zona se dedican exclusivamente a la agricultura y a la ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de aves de corral como pollos, gallinas, patos, etc. cuenta con clientela fija en la zona y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. Además percibe ingresos adicionales por dictar clases particulares en su domicilio. El destino del crédito será para la construcción de paredes en su vivienda y para realizar algunas reparaciones ya que se encuentra en mal estado, esto mejorará las condiciones de su vivienda y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Gamaniel is 35 years old and married. He has been living in the Buenos Aires district in Morropón province for more than 20 years, Morropón is in the Piura region on Peru's north coast. Life in the community here is peaceful and the locals work in farming and cattle-raising.

Luis himself makes a living selling poultry such as chickens, hens, and ducks. He has regular customers in the local area and has good personal and professional references. Luis also makes a little extra by giving private tuition in his home.

This loan will be used to build walls around Luis' home and to carry out some repairs as his house is in bad condition. This loan will improve conditions at Luis' home and therefore will increase his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to build walls around his home and to make some repairs as it is not in very good condition.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 34 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Jovelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Jovelyn has worked in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 43 years old and married with two children currently in school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Rosita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, and cereals. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya is a 45-year-old lady who is spending her life with her husband, three daughters and two sons.

She is taking a loan to purchase raw materials for knitting handmade embroidery; in fact her whole family is involved in this business. All of them are very expert in their professions and knit very fine bridal dresses at home.

Due to demand they are facing a shortage of material and are unable to knit fine embroidery. Therefore, Zakiya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can reduce the shortage of embroidery raw material. Through this amount she will buy stock of thread, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Zakiya is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of thread, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Reyna Esperanza

texts.es: Reyna se encuentra muy feliz, muy satisfecha, muy contenta porque gracias al apoyo financiero por los inversionistas en KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL ella pudo comprar los insumos que eran necesarios aplicar a sus cultivos de café, dando una mayor y mejor asistencia para que estos estuviesen protegidos de plagas, cambios de clima, etc. Gracias a su primer financiamiento su vida mejoro ya que en un principio no tenía los recursos económicos para poder comprar los insumos que necesitaba y gracias a la confianza que la cooperativa depósito en ella y tomándola en cuenta compro los abonos, foliares, fertilizantes con los que dio asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café logrando obtener excelentes ganancias sobre su cosecha y pudiendo ponerse al día con su financiamiento. Ella nuevamente pide ser apoyada con un segundo financiamiento el cual invertirá en poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que después de la corta las plantas quedan un poco maltratadas y deterioradas así como también la limpieza de la misma de maleza entre otras.
texts.en: Reyna is extremely happy and satisfied with the financial support she received from Kiva and COMIXMUL, because she was able to buy the farm supplies she needed to tend to her coffee plants and better protect them from insects, bad weather, etc. Thanks to that first loan, Reyna's life was much improved. She would not have otherwise been able to buy the supplies she needed. Thanks to the communal bank's confidence in her, she was able to buy manure, foliar fertiliser, and normal fertiliser. She will never forget this opportunity that was afforded to her, since it enabled her to tend to her coffee plants and make a good profit on her harvest. She is now faring much better financially. She now asks for a second loan in order to keep tending to her coffee plants, since, after the harvest, the plants are somewhat damaged. She will also need to weed her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Aturanagyayo Association Group

texts.en:
William is a 45-year-old man, married with 4 school-going children out of 6 living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He is a member of Aturanagyayo group, where each member guarantees the other for the loan. 

William has been in the crop-growing business for over 10 years in the rural areas. William started his business to get more income for educating his children, like any parent who loves his children. He is faced with the problem of climatic changes like drought, which affects the crops. 

William needs a loan to buy farm inputs like herbicides for spraying.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like herbicides for spraying.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 45 years old and a widower. He has 7 children still in school. He deals in the goat trade as the major business, and also he has a big coffee plantation where he harvests his own coffee for selling. 

He is taking a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) to help him buy more goats for sale this Christmas season, with a hope of yielding more profits from them. 

His challenge is that he can’t go too far to markets, since he is the only one at home, for fear of leaving the children at home and thieves who can steal the remaining goats. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Surajo Umar

texts.en:
Surajo Umar is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Surajo Umar joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sadiq and Simon.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Surajo Umar would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Surajo Umar can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Surajo Umar spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José, de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, se casó a los 20 años,  su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa y al cuidado de sus hijos, solo dos de sus hijos estudian, los demás trabajan pero todos viven en casa.

José es empleado, se desempeña como seguridad en una residencial, tiene más de 3 años de trabajar así, con lo que ha logrado ganar una buena reputación, el trabajo se lo recomendó un amigo que también trabajaba como seguridad.

No tenía experiencia en el trabajo, por lo que le toco poco a poco ir aprendiendo.- Antes de ser empleado trabajaba en la agricultura, la distancia que recorre todos los días es de 50 km diarios, la forma de transportarse es en bus, por lo que le toca levantarse muy temprano y su  horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:30 p.m.  

José necesita es préstamo para comprar arena, hierro, cemento, lamina, madera y pagar la mano de obra.- Todo esto para mejorar su vivienda pues está pensando en ampliarla.

El sueño de José es ver a sus hijos graduados como profesionales exitosos, también desea tener una casa más grande en donde puedan vivir sus hijos con mayores comodidades.
texts.en:
José, 39, went to school until the ninth form. He got married at twenty. His wife takes care of the household and of their children. Only two of the children still go to school, while the others work, but all live at their parents'.
José works as a security guard at a residential complex and has been in this job for three years. He has a good reputation. He started this job on an idea from a friend, who also works in security.
He did not know anything about this field of work, so he had to learn by experience. Before this, he used to be a farmer. He goes to work by bus and lives 50 km away from his place of employment, so he needs to wake up very early every day. He works from 7 am to 4.30 pm. 
José needs this loan in order to buy sand, iron, cement, metal sheets, and wood, and to hire help. These materials he needs to improve his house, which he is thinking of extending.
José's dream is to see his children graduate and become successful professionals. He also wishes to have a bigger house in which his children can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and hire help.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari, or retail store, business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Wilma wants to improve her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this, she joined CEVI to gain access to loans. Wilma is now requesting to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and candies, rice, bread and snack foods. With a loan, she will be able improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Wilma hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and candies, rice, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La socia Leonor se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche y sigue trabajando como profesora,la socia por meio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar es tener un local donde pueda vender la leche.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche.



La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonor is still selling milk to supplement her teacher's income. She wants to improve her lot in life and her dream is to have a shop where she can sell milk. She is applying for the loan to buy milk.
She is happy with the loan and promises to be punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Otília de 52 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos, 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino secundário e outra e independente  vive na sua própria casa. Ela è agricultora informal de produtos da machamba, actividade que esta a explorar a mais de 20 anos junto com a sua filha, culturas de feijão verde, cebola, tomate e mais diversas culturas.
Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar insumos agrícolas (sementes de tomate, cebola, pepino e pagamento de lavoura da machamba.)
Tem como grande desafio aumentar a sua produtividade das suas culturas para garantir a sua reforma e a sustentabilidade da sua família.
texts.en:
Otília is a 52 year old married mother to 2 children: 1 of whom attends secondary school and the other is already living independently. Otília lives in her own home and works as a casual farmer growing, among other items, goods such as green beans, onions and tomatoes. She has been doing this kind of work for more than 20 years and she is assisted in it by her daughter.
She plans to use this loan to buy farming supplies, such as seeds for growing tomatoes, onions, cucumbers and to pay for the farm land to be tilled. The greatest challenge that she faces is increasing her level of production to ensure growth and long term sustainability for her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as seeds for growing tomatoes, onions, cucumbers and to pay for the farm to be tilled.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic essentials, such as green beans, peanuts, rice, tomato and other items.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria de 47 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada, su esposo es empleado y trabaja como seguridad privada en una empresa,  tiene tres hijos, dos independientes y solo su hija depende de ella ya que esta enferma y tiene que pagar el tratamiento y sus medicamentos.

Gloria es comerciante, tiene 30 años de vender verduras y pescado, pero desde hace 10 dejó el mercado municipal y se trasladó a su casa para estar pendiente de su hija si dejar su negocio, además tiene un chatarrera. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar juegos pirotecnicos nacionales y extranjeros para vender en la víspera de navidad y año nuevo, todos los años aprovecha esta época y siempre obtiene muy buenos resultados de su inversión. Sueña con mejorar la infraestructura del lugar que utiliza en su casa para vender repara el techo para no tener problemas en la época lluviosa porque se le moja el producto.
texts.en:
Gloria, 47, was not fortunate enough to go to school. She is married to a security guard who works for a private company. They have three children, two of whom are independent. The last one, a girl, is sick, and Gloria has to pay for her treatment and her medication.
Gloria has been selling vegetables and fish for thirty years. Ten years ago, she left her stall at the town market to open a shop at her house, in order to be able to care for her daughter without having to leave the shop. She also sells scrap. 
She asks for a loan in order to buy fireworks (local and imported) to sell for the holidays. She takes advantage of Christmas and New Year every year and it always pays off. She dreams of improving the shop at her house, since the roof is leaking and her wares get wet during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy fireworks to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Wilfredo

texts.es:
Nelson de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, está casado y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 19 y 17 años de edad, dos trabaja y una estudia, además vive con 3 nietos; su esposa es comerciante y vende comida que ella misma prepara.

Nelson es mecánico y desde hace 15 años tiene un taller de mecánica y aprendió trabajando como empleado en el taller de un familiar durante 17 años. Ahora su hijo trabaja con él. Solicita el préstamo para comprar un compresor y un par de jacks para las funciones del taller. Espera en un futuro contribuir con su esposa y poner un comedor
texts.en:
Nelson, 44, went to school until the ninth form. He is married and has three children, aged 24, 19, and 17 respectively. Two of them work and one, a girl, goes to school. Three grandchildren live with them. Nelson's wife sells home-made food.
Nelson is a mechanic and has had a workshop for fifteen years. He learned the trade working as an employee at a family member's workshop for seventeen years. His son now works with him. He asks for the loan in order to buy a compressor and a couple of jacks for his workshop. His hopes for the future include opening a restaurant with his wife.

loans.use: to buy tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Lampson

texts.es: LAMPSON: Es de Bilwi, es un hombre trabajador, tiene 54 años de edad, casado, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad y dos en edad escolar. Con el fin de reducir el hacinamiento, mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener su propia vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita un préstamo para construir su vivienda de  madera y tambo. En un solar que le obsequio su mama. Anteriormente habitaba en casa de familiares compartida con 12 personas. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera, postes de madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir un muro de maya en su terreno, para mayor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en: Lampson comes from Bilwi. He is a hard-working 54-year-old man who is married and has five children, of whom three are adults and two still go to school. In order to reduce overcrowding, improve his family's living conditions and the safety of his house, and live in dignity, he asks for a loan to build a pile dwelling out of wood, on a plot of land given to him by his mother. In the meantime, he lives at a family member's house, sharing the rooms with twelve other people. With the loan, he wants to buy construction materials, such as wood, wooden pillars, zinc, and nails, and to hire help. His dream is to build a mesh wall on his plot in order to keep his family safe.

loans.use: to build a pile dwelling out of wood.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A Sra. Maria de 57 anos de idade, viuva mae de 4 filhos dos quais 3 sao indepedente e 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino secundario. Ela è pensionista militar, è tambem agricultora de sequeiro produz cultura demilho e mandioca, actividade que esta a praticar a mais de 25 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, porta, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para reabilitar a sua casa.
texts.en: Maria is a 57 year old, widowed mother to 4 children: 3 of whom live independently and her youngest attends high school. Maria receives a military pension and she is also an uplands farmer growing corn and cassava, an activity that she has been engaged in for more than 25 years. She plans to use this loan to buy building materials, such as blocks, cement, doors, stone and to pay labour costs, so that she can rebuild her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as blocks, cement, doors, stone and to pay labour costs, so that she can rebuild her home.

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 40 years old and a widow with three children who are all in school.

Maricon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Maricon has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for ten years and also earns an income from personal products.

Maricon aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Caridad Bonna

texts.en: Caridad Bonna is 41 years old, single and lives in Pallua with her mother. She manages a vegetable stall to earn income. Her mother also has a store. Caridad Bonna aims for a better income to save funds to use for emergency purposes. She wants to buy more vegetables but she has insufficient funds, so she is now asking for 30,000 PHP. She will buy meat and vegetables (squash, tomato, eggplant) to sell. Additional vegetables will help increase her sales capacity and her income as well.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables (squash, tomato, eggplant) to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 44-year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mildred has a clothing business in the Philippines. Mildred has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of clothing to sell. Mildred has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es una mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 3 meses de edad, y su negocio es la venta de frazadas.
Ella es emprendedora, dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes comercios de la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ caracterizada por mantenerse como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, hasta en los distritos urbanos. Maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo se producen en Sacaba. También tienen granjas de pollos e incluso se trabaja en la apicultura. De clima templado durante todo el año.
Emilia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su bebé, viven en una casa familiar que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de frazadas; ella ambula en diferentes ferias, mercados y comercios, de la localidad cargada de frazadas de 1 plaza, 2 plazas y alguna con diseños infantiles. “Estamos conscientes de que la calidad de las frazadas nacionales es buena, pero nos resulta realmente caro y preferimos comprar las sintéticas, porque además de tener buenos diseños y ser calientes, tienen una mejor presentación…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su casa propia. Debido al conocimiento del negocio ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser para realizar un emprendimiento en la confección de cubrecamas y sábanas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Emilia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser y emprender su negocio de confección.
texts.en:
Emilia is a 21-year-old woman. She is single and has a three-month-old son. She works selling blankets. She is an entrepreneurial, sweet, affectionate, caring, sincere, responsible and hardworking woman. She works as a street vendor and visits different commercial areas of Sacaba, which is known for its urban agriculture activities, and the production of cereals, vegetables and fruits: corn, wheat, barley, vegetables, strawberries, bananas, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches and even banana passionfruit. There are also chicken farms and beekeeping activities. The weather is mild all year long.

Emilia is dark-skinned and has long, black hair. Her native tongue is Quechua, but she speaks Spanish due to cultural reasons and because of her job. She shares her life with her baby. They live in a house served with electricity and they have a water well. She sells blankets and visits different fairs, markets and commercial areas carrying blankets for one or two persons, some of them with patterns for children. “We know that the blankets that are produced locally are of good quality, but they are very expensive so we prefer to buy synthetic blankets instead. Besides having nice designs and being warm, they come in a better package,” she says.

Her dream is to buy a house. Now that she has experience, she wants to invest in her business and buy a sewing machine. This would allow her to make bed covers and sheets. This is her first loan with the institution, but she has been in this business for two years. This is why Emilia is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine and start her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and start her sewing business.

loans.name: Lidia Damares

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda, vive con su hija en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en el sector son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ropa y zapatos para aumentar el stock de su negocio, con esto Lidia espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo así sus gustos y necesidades, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y tendrá un gran impacto en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia is 51 years old, a widow, and lives with her daughter in the Pucará district, located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.  The primary economic activities of the area are agriculture, animal husbandry, and commerce. 

She works selling clothing and shoes and has 10 years of experience in the business with very good personal and work references in the zone. The current loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of clothing and shoes to augment her business's stock. With this, Lidia hopes to offer a wider variety of products to her customers, in this way satisfying their tastes and needs, which will generate more income and will have a great impact on her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of clothing and shoes to augment her business's stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy condiments for preparing the dishes she sells in her "restaurant": onions, peas, pepper...

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Vanessa De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Vanessa de los Milagros tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en la provincia de Morropón, ubicado en la región de Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. Esta comunidad se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar el stock de su tienda, con esto Vanessa espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo así sus gustos y preferencias, lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Vanessa de los Milagros is 28 years old, partnered, and lives with her partner and her minor son in the province of Morropón, located in Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. This community works in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. 

She works selling ladies', men's, and children's clothing. Her business is located in her home. She has experience with the business and very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of clothing to augment her store's stock. With this, Vanessa hopes to offer a wider variety of products to her customers, in this way satisfying their tastes and preferences, which will have a positive impact on her income level and will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of clothing to augment her store's stock.

loans.name: Ysai

texts.es:
Ysai tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa Norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola, contando con herramientas propias, una de ellas es su moto lineal la cual le permite desplazarse hacia sus labores diarias como peón-jornalero. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales como comerciales. Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento de la infraestructura donde guarda sus herramientas y su moto, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas. Con esto Ysai espera mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, así mismo mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Ysai is 44 years old and in a common-law relationship. He lives with his wife and child in a remote area of the district of Oyotún which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the North coast of Peru. The people of this district mainly work in agriculture, cattle farming and business. 
He makes a living delivering services as a farm labourer with his own tools. One of these tools is his motorcycle which allows him to move around to his daily jobs as a day labourer. He has over ten years of experience in this and has very good personal and business references. He is asking for this loan to maintain the building where he keeps his tools and his motorcycle. This loan will allow him to have his tools and equipment in better condition. With this, Ysai hopes to improve the productivity of his services and therefore be able to meet the different needs of his customers in the area and also to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to maintain the building where he keeps his tools and motorcycle.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
Aurelio tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Este distrito está habitado por gente amable y trabajadora dedicada principalmente al comercio, ganadería y agricultura.

El se dedica a la venta de alfalfa la cual siembra en un terreno agrícola propio, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 20 meses de manera continua. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su terreno agrícola, con esto Aurelio espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio y así poder ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá aumentar su nivel de ingresos y con esto mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 63 years old, married, and lives with his spouse in their own house in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. This district is inhabited by friendly and hard-working people who primarily work in commerce, animal husbandry and agriculture. 

He works selling alfalfa which he grows on his own agricultural land. He has worked in this field for more than 20 months continuously. He has very good personal and work references in his district. The current loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizers to maintain his agricultural land well. With this, Aurelio hopes to improve his business's productivity and in this way offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to increase his income level and, with this, it will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers to maintain his agricultural land well.

loans.name: Sandrina

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Sandrina works hard to support her family.

She has a handicrafts business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from working in a general store. Sandrina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wire, shells and nylon thread for her handicrafts business.

Sandrina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wire, shells and nylon thread

loans.name: Luna Grace

texts.en:
Luna Grace is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from working in e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Luna Grace is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.
